122std::string get_ascii_tile_id( const uint32_t sym, const int FG, const int BG )
123{
124 return std::string( { 'A', 'S', 'C', 'I', 'I', '_', static_cast<char>( sym ), static_cast<char>( FG ), static_cast<char>( BG ) } );
125}
126
127pixel_minimap_mode pixel_minimap_mode_from_string( const std::string &mode )
128{
129 if( mode == "solid" ) {
130 return pixel_minimap_mode::solid;
131 } else if( mode == "squares" ) {
132 return pixel_minimap_mode::squares;
133 } else if( mode == "dots" ) {
134 return pixel_minimap_mode::dots;
135 }
136
137 debugmsg( "Unsupported pixel minimap mode \"" + mode + "\"." );
138 return pixel_minimap_mode::solid;
139}

143static int msgtype_to_tilecolor( const game_message_type type, const bool bOldMsg )
144{
145 const int iBold = bOldMsg ? 0 : 8;
146
147 switch( type ) {
148 case m_good:
149 return iBold + catacurses::green;
150 case m_bad:
151 return iBold + catacurses::red;
152 case m_mixed:
153 case m_headshot:
154 return iBold + catacurses::magenta;
155 case m_neutral:
156 return iBold + catacurses::white;
157 case m_warning:
158 case m_critical:
159 return iBold + catacurses::yellow;
160 case m_info:
161 case m_grazing:
162 return iBold + catacurses::blue;
163 default:
164 break;
165 }
166
167 return -1;
168}

170formatted_text::formatted_text( const std::string &text, const int color,
171 const direction text_direction )
172 : text( text ), color( color )
173{
174 switch( text_direction ) {
175 case direction::NORTHWEST:
176 case direction::WEST:
177 case direction::SOUTHWEST:
178 alignment = text_alignment::right;
179 break;
180 case direction::NORTH:
181 case direction::CENTER:
182 case direction::SOUTH:
183 alignment = text_alignment::center;
184 break;
185 default:
186 alignment = text_alignment::left;
187 break;
188 }
189}
190
191void idle_animation_manager::prepare_for_redraw()
192{
193 // Forget about animations from previous frame
194 present_ = false;
195
196 if( !enabled_ ) {
197 frame = 0;
198 return;
199 }
200
201 // Use system clock to keep steady frame rate
202 auto now = std::chrono::system_clock::now();
203 auto now_ms = std::chrono::time_point_cast<std::chrono::milliseconds>( now );
204 auto value = now_ms.time_since_epoch();
205 // Aiming roughly at the standard 60 frames per second
206 frame = value.count() / 17;
207}

240void cata_tiles::on_options_changed()
241{
242 memory_map_mode = get_option <std::string>( "MEMORY_MAP_MODE" );
243
244 pixel_minimap_settings settings;
245
246 settings.mode = pixel_minimap_mode_from_string( get_option<std::string>( "PIXEL_MINIMAP_MODE" ) );
247 settings.brightness = get_option<int>( "PIXEL_MINIMAP_BRIGHTNESS" );
248 settings.beacon_size = get_option<int>( "PIXEL_MINIMAP_BEACON_SIZE" );
249 settings.beacon_blink_interval = get_option<bool>( "ANIMATIONS" ) ?
250 get_option<int>( "PIXEL_MINIMAP_BLINK" ) : 0;
251 settings.square_pixels = get_option<bool>( "PIXEL_MINIMAP_RATIO" );
252 settings.scale_to_fit = get_option<bool>( "PIXEL_MINIMAP_SCALE_TO_FIT" );
253
254 minimap->set_settings( settings );
255}

257const tile_type *tileset::find_tile_type( const std::string &id ) const
258{
259 const auto iter = tile_ids.find( id );
260 return iter != tile_ids.end() ? &iter->second : nullptr;

262
263cata::optional<tile_lookup_res>
264tileset::find_tile_type_by_season( const std::string &id, season_type season ) const
265{
266 assert( season < season_type::NUM_SEASONS );
267 const auto iter = tile_ids_by_season[season].find( id );
268
269 if( iter == tile_ids_by_season[season].end() ) {
270 return cata::nullopt;
271 }
272 auto &res = iter->second;
273 if( res.season_tile ) {
274 return *res.season_tile;
275 } else if( res.default_tile ) { // can skip this check, but just in case
276 return tile_lookup_res( iter->first, *res.default_tile );
277 }
278 debugmsg( "empty record found in `tile_ids_by_season` for key: %s", id );
279 return cata::nullopt;
280}
281
282tile_type &tileset::create_tile_type( const std::string &id, tile_type &&new_tile_type )
283{
284 // Must overwrite existing tile
285 // TODO: c++17 - replace [] + find() with insert_or_assign()
286 tile_ids[id] = std::move( new_tile_type );
287 auto inserted = tile_ids.find( id );
288
289 const std::string &inserted_id = inserted->first;
290 tile_type &inserted_tile = inserted->second;
291
292 // populate cache by season
293 constexpr size_t suffix_len = 15;
294 constexpr char season_suffix[4][suffix_len] = {
295 "_season_spring", "_season_summer", "_season_autumn", "_season_winter"
296 };
297 bool has_season_suffix = false;
298 for( int i = 0; i < 4; i++ ) {
299 if( string_ends_with( id, season_suffix[i] ) ) {
300 has_season_suffix = true;
301 // key is id without _season suffix
302 season_tile_value &value = tile_ids_by_season[i][id.substr( 0,
303 id.size() - strlen( season_suffix[i] ) )];
304 // value stores reference to string id with _season suffix
305 value.season_tile = tile_lookup_res( inserted_id, inserted_tile );
306 break;
307 }
308 }
309 // tile doesn't have _season suffix, add it as "default" into all four seasons
310 if( !has_season_suffix ) {
311 for( auto &tile_ids_for_season : tile_ids_by_season ) {
312 tile_ids_for_season[id].default_tile = &inserted_tile;
313 }
314 }
315
316 return inserted_tile;
317}
318
319void cata_tiles::load_tileset( const std::string &tileset_id, const bool precheck,
320 const bool force )
321{
322 if( tileset_ptr && tileset_ptr->get_tileset_id() == tileset_id && !force ) {
323 return;
324 }
325 // TODO: move into clear or somewhere else.
326 // reset the overlay ordering from the previous loaded tileset
327 tileset_mutation_overlay_ordering.clear();
328
329 // Load the tileset into a separate instance and only set this->tileset_ptr
330 // when the loading has succeeded.
331 std::unique_ptr<tileset> new_tileset_ptr = std::make_unique<tileset>();
332 tileset_loader loader( *new_tileset_ptr, renderer );
333 loader.load( tileset_id, precheck );
334 tileset_ptr = std::move( new_tileset_ptr );
335
336 set_draw_scale( 16 );
337
338 minimap->set_type( tile_iso ? pixel_minimap_type::iso : pixel_minimap_type::ortho );
339}
340
341void cata_tiles::reinit()
342{
343 set_draw_scale( 16 );
344 RenderClear( renderer );
345}
346
347static void get_tile_information( const std::string &config_path, std::string &json_path,
348 std::string &tileset_path )
349{
350 const std::string default_json = PATH_INFO::defaulttilejson();
351 const std::string default_tileset = PATH_INFO::defaulttilepng();
352
353 // Get JSON and TILESET vars from config
354 const auto reader = [&]( std::istream & fin ) {
355 while( !fin.eof() ) {
356 std::string sOption;
357 fin >> sOption;
358
359 if( sOption.empty() ) {
360 getline( fin, sOption );
361 } else if( sOption[0] == '#' ) {
362 // Skip comment
363 getline( fin, sOption );
364 } else if( sOption.find( "JSON" ) != std::string::npos ) {
365 fin >> json_path;
366 dbg( DL::Info ) << "JSON path set to [" << json_path << "].";
367 } else if( sOption.find( "TILESET" ) != std::string::npos ) {
368 fin >> tileset_path;
369 dbg( DL::Info ) << "TILESET path set to [" << tileset_path << "].";
370 } else {
371 getline( fin, sOption );
372 }
373 }
374 };
375
376 if( !read_from_file( config_path, reader ) ) {
377 json_path = default_json;
378 tileset_path = default_tileset;
379 }
380
381 if( json_path.empty() ) {
382 json_path = default_json;
383 dbg( DL::Info ) << "JSON set to default [" << json_path << "].";
384 }
385 if( tileset_path.empty() ) {
386 tileset_path = default_tileset;
387 dbg( DL::Info ) << "TILESET set to default [" << tileset_path << "].";
388 }
389}
390
391template<typename PixelConverter>
392static SDL_Surface_Ptr apply_color_filter( const SDL_Surface_Ptr &original,
393 PixelConverter pixel_converter )
394{
395 assert( original );
396 SDL_Surface_Ptr surf = create_surface_32( original->w, original->h );
397 assert( surf );
398 throwErrorIf( SDL_BlitSurface( original.get(), nullptr, surf.get(), nullptr ) != 0,
399 "SDL_BlitSurface failed" );
400
401 auto pix = reinterpret_cast<SDL_Color *>( surf->pixels );
402
403 for( int y = 0, ey = surf->h; y < ey; ++y ) {
404 for( int x = 0, ex = surf->w; x < ex; ++x, ++pix ) {
405 if( pix->a == 0x00 ) {
406 // This check significantly improves the performance since
407 // vast majority of pixels in the tilesets are completely transparent.
408 continue;
409 }
410 *pix = pixel_converter( *pix );
411 }
412 }
413
414 return surf;
415}
416
417static bool is_contained( const SDL_Rect &smaller, const SDL_Rect &larger )
418{
419 return smaller.x >= larger.x &&
420 smaller.y >= larger.y &&
421 smaller.x + smaller.w <= larger.x + larger.w &&
422 smaller.y + smaller.h <= larger.y + larger.h;
423}
424
425bool tileset_loader::copy_surface_to_texture( const SDL_Surface_Ptr &surf, const point &offset,
426 std::vector<texture> &target )
427{
428 assert( surf );
429 const rect_range<SDL_Rect> input_range( sprite_width, sprite_height, point( surf->w / sprite_width,
430 surf->h / sprite_height ) );
431
432 const std::shared_ptr<SDL_Texture> texture_ptr = CreateTextureFromSurface( renderer, surf );
433 if( !texture_ptr ) {
434 return false;
435 }
436
437 for( const SDL_Rect rect : input_range ) {
438 assert( offset.x % sprite_width == 0 );
439 assert( offset.y % sprite_height == 0 );
440 const point pos( offset + point( rect.x, rect.y ) );
441 assert( pos.x % sprite_width == 0 );
442 assert( pos.y % sprite_height == 0 );
443 const size_t index = this->offset + ( pos.x / sprite_width ) + ( pos.y / sprite_height ) *
444 ( tile_atlas_width / sprite_width );
445 assert( index < target.size() );
446 assert( target[index].dimension() == std::make_pair( 0, 0 ) );
447 target[index] = texture( texture_ptr, rect );
448 }
449 return true;
450}
451
452bool tileset_loader::create_textures_from_tile_atlas( const SDL_Surface_Ptr &tile_atlas,
453 const point &offset )
454{
455 assert( tile_atlas );
456
457 /** perform color filter conversion here */
458 using tiles_pixel_color_entry = std::tuple<std::vector<texture>*, std::string>;
459 std::array<tiles_pixel_color_entry, 5> tile_values_data = {{
460 { std::make_tuple( &ts.tile_values, "color_pixel_none" ) },
461 { std::make_tuple( &ts.shadow_tile_values, "color_pixel_grayscale" ) },
462 { std::make_tuple( &ts.night_tile_values, "color_pixel_nightvision" ) },
463 { std::make_tuple( &ts.overexposed_tile_values, "color_pixel_overexposed" ) },
464 { std::make_tuple( &ts.memory_tile_values, tilecontext->memory_map_mode ) }
465 }
466 };
467 for( tiles_pixel_color_entry &entry : tile_values_data ) {
468 std::vector<texture> *tile_values = std::get<0>( entry );
469 color_pixel_function_pointer color_pixel_function = get_color_pixel_function( std::get<1>
470 ( entry ) );
471 bool success;
472 if( !color_pixel_function ) {
473 // TODO: Move it inside apply_color_filter.
474 success = copy_surface_to_texture( tile_atlas, offset, *tile_values );
475 } else {
476 success = copy_surface_to_texture( apply_color_filter( tile_atlas, color_pixel_function ), offset,
477 *tile_values );
478 }
479 if( !success ) {
480 return false;
481 }
482 }
483 return true;
484}
485
486template<typename T>
487static void extend_vector_by( std::vector<T> &vec, const size_t additional_size )
488{
489 vec.resize( vec.size() + additional_size );
490}
491
492void tileset_loader::load_tileset( const std::string &img_path )
493{
494 const SDL_Surface_Ptr tile_atlas = load_image( img_path.c_str() );
495 assert( tile_atlas );
496 tile_atlas_width = tile_atlas->w;
497
498 if( R >= 0 && R <= 255 && G >= 0 && G <= 255 && B >= 0 && B <= 255 ) {
499 const Uint32 key = SDL_MapRGB( tile_atlas->format, 0, 0, 0 );
500 throwErrorIf( SDL_SetColorKey( tile_atlas.get(), SDL_TRUE, key ) != 0, "SDL_SetColorKey failed" );
501 throwErrorIf( SDL_SetSurfaceRLE( tile_atlas.get(), 1 ), "SDL_SetSurfaceRLE failed" );
502 }
503
504 SDL_RendererInfo info;
505 throwErrorIf( SDL_GetRendererInfo( renderer.get(), &info ) != 0, "SDL_GetRendererInfo failed" );
506 // Software rendering stores textures as surfaces with run-length encoding, which makes extracting a part
507 // in the middle of the texture slow. Therefore this "simulates" that the renderer only supports one tile
508 // per texture. Each tile will go on its own texture object.
509 if( info.flags & SDL_RENDERER_SOFTWARE ) {
510 info.max_texture_width = sprite_width;
511 info.max_texture_height = sprite_height;
512 }
513 // for debugging only: force a very small maximal texture size, as to trigger
514 // splitting the tile atlas.
515#if 0
516 // +1 to check correct rounding
517 info.max_texture_width = sprite_width * 10 + 1;
518 info.max_texture_height = sprite_height * 20 + 1;
519#endif
520
521 const int min_tile_xcount = 128;
522 const int min_tile_ycount = min_tile_xcount * 2;
523
524 if( info.max_texture_width == 0 ) {
525 info.max_texture_width = sprite_width * min_tile_xcount;
526 dbg( DL::Info ) <<
527 "SDL_RendererInfo max_texture_width was set to 0. Changing it to " <<
528 info.max_texture_width;
529 } else {
530 throwErrorIf( info.max_texture_width < sprite_width,
531 "Maximal texture width is smaller than tile width" );
532 }
533
534 if( info.max_texture_height == 0 ) {
535 info.max_texture_height = sprite_height * min_tile_ycount;
536 dbg( DL::Info ) <<
537 "SDL_RendererInfo max_texture_height was set to 0. Changing it to "
538 << info.max_texture_height;
539 } else {
540 throwErrorIf( info.max_texture_height < sprite_height,
541 "Maximal texture height is smaller than tile height" );
542 }
543
544 // Number of tiles in each dimension that fits into a (maximal) SDL texture.
545 // If the tile atlas contains more than that, we have to split it.
546 const int max_tile_xcount = info.max_texture_width / sprite_width;
547 const int max_tile_ycount = info.max_texture_height / sprite_height;
548 // Range over the tile atlas, wherein each rectangle fits into the maximal
549 // SDL texture size. In other words: a range over the parts into which the
550 // tile atlas needs to be split.
551 const rect_range<SDL_Rect> output_range(
552 max_tile_xcount * sprite_width,
553 max_tile_ycount * sprite_height,
554 point( divide_round_up( tile_atlas->w, info.max_texture_width ), divide_round_up( tile_atlas->h,
555 info.max_texture_height ) ) );
556
557 const int expected_tilecount = ( tile_atlas->w / sprite_width ) * ( tile_atlas->h / sprite_height );
558 extend_vector_by( ts.tile_values, expected_tilecount );
559 extend_vector_by( ts.shadow_tile_values, expected_tilecount );
560 extend_vector_by( ts.night_tile_values, expected_tilecount );
561 extend_vector_by( ts.overexposed_tile_values, expected_tilecount );
562 extend_vector_by( ts.memory_tile_values, expected_tilecount );
563
564 for( const SDL_Rect sub_rect : output_range ) {
565 assert( sub_rect.x % sprite_width == 0 );
566 assert( sub_rect.y % sprite_height == 0 );
567 assert( sub_rect.w % sprite_width == 0 );
568 assert( sub_rect.h % sprite_height == 0 );
569 SDL_Surface_Ptr smaller_surf;
570
571 if( is_contained( SDL_Rect{ 0, 0, tile_atlas->w, tile_atlas->h }, sub_rect ) ) {
572 // can use tile_atlas directly, it is completely contained in the output rectangle
573 } else {
574 // Need a temporary surface that contains the parts of the tile atlas that fit
575 // into sub_rect. But doesn't always need to be as large as sub_rect.
576 const int w = std::min( tile_atlas->w - sub_rect.x, sub_rect.w );
577 const int h = std::min( tile_atlas->h - sub_rect.y, sub_rect.h );
578 smaller_surf = ::create_surface_32( w, h );
579 assert( smaller_surf );
580 const SDL_Rect inp{ sub_rect.x, sub_rect.y, w, h };
581 throwErrorIf( SDL_BlitSurface( tile_atlas.get(), &inp, smaller_surf.get(), nullptr ) != 0,
582 "SDL_BlitSurface failed" );
583 }
584 const SDL_Surface_Ptr &surf_to_use = smaller_surf ? smaller_surf : tile_atlas;
585 assert( surf_to_use );
586
587 if( !create_textures_from_tile_atlas( surf_to_use, point( sub_rect.x, sub_rect.y ) ) ) {
588 // May happen on some systems - there's nothing we can do about it
589 throw std::runtime_error(
590 _(
591 "Failed to create texture atlas, see debug.log for details. "
592 "This commonly happens if the device is low on memory. "
593 "Try rebooting device, or using another tileset or a different renderer."
594 )
595 );
596 }
597 }
598
599 size = expected_tilecount;
600}
601
602void cata_tiles::set_draw_scale( int scale )
603{
604 assert( tileset_ptr );
605 tile_width = tileset_ptr->get_tile_width() * tileset_ptr->get_tile_pixelscale() * scale / 16;
606 tile_height = tileset_ptr->get_tile_height() * tileset_ptr->get_tile_pixelscale() * scale / 16;
607
608 tile_ratiox = ( static_cast<float>( tile_width ) / static_cast<float>( fontwidth ) );
609 tile_ratioy = ( static_cast<float>( tile_height ) / static_cast<float>( fontheight ) );
610}
611
612void tileset_loader::load( const std::string &tileset_id, const bool precheck )
613{
614 std::string json_conf;
615 std::string tileset_path;
616 std::string tileset_root;
617
618 const auto tset_iter = TILESETS.find( tileset_id );
619 if( tset_iter != TILESETS.end() ) {
620 tileset_root = tset_iter->second;
621 dbg( DL::Info ) << '"' << tileset_id << '"' << " tileset: found config file path: " << tileset_root;
622 get_tile_information( tileset_root + '/' + PATH_INFO::tileset_conf(),
623 json_conf, tileset_path );
624 dbg( DL::Info ) << "Current tileset is: " << tileset_id;
625 } else {
626 dbg( DL::Error ) << "Tileset \"" << tileset_id << "\" from options is invalid";
627 json_conf = PATH_INFO::defaulttilejson();
628 tileset_path = PATH_INFO::defaulttilepng();
629 }
630
631 std::string json_path = tileset_root + '/' + json_conf;
632 std::string img_path = tileset_root + '/' + tileset_path;
633
634 dbg( DL::Info ) << "Attempting to Load JSON file " << json_path;
635 std::ifstream config_file( json_path.c_str(), std::ifstream::in | std::ifstream::binary );
636
637 if( !config_file.good() ) {
638 throw std::runtime_error( std::string( "Failed to open tile info json: " ) + json_path );
639 }
640
641 JsonIn config_json( config_file );
642 JsonObject config = config_json.get_object();
643
644 // "tile_info" section must exist.
645 if( !config.has_member( "tile_info" ) ) {
646 config.throw_error( "\"tile_info\" missing" );
647 }
648
649 for( const JsonObject &curr_info : config.get_array( "tile_info" ) ) {
650 ts.tile_height = curr_info.get_int( "height" );
651 ts.tile_width = curr_info.get_int( "width" );
652 tile_iso = curr_info.get_bool( "iso", false );
653 ts.tile_pixelscale = curr_info.get_float( "pixelscale", 1.0f );
654 }
655
656 if( precheck ) {
657 config.allow_omitted_members();
658 return;
659 }
660
661 // Load tile information if available.
662 offset = 0;
663 load_internal( config, tileset_root, img_path );
664
665 // Load mod tilesets if available
666 for( const mod_tileset &mts : all_mod_tilesets ) {
667 // Set sprite_id offset to separate from other tilesets.
668 sprite_id_offset = offset;
669 tileset_root = mts.get_base_path();
670 json_path = mts.get_full_path();
671
672 if( !mts.is_compatible( tileset_id ) ) {
673 dbg( DL::Info ) << "Mod tileset in \"" << json_path << "\" is not compatible.";
674 continue;
675 }
676 dbg( DL::Info ) << "Attempting to Load JSON file " << json_path;
677 std::ifstream mod_config_file( json_path.c_str(), std::ifstream::in | std::ifstream::binary );
678
679 if( !mod_config_file.good() ) {
680 throw std::runtime_error( std::string( "Failed to open tile info json: " ) + json_path );
681 }
682
683 JsonIn mod_config_json( mod_config_file );
684
685 const auto mark_visited = []( const JsonObject & jobj ) {
686 // These fields have been visited in load_mod_tileset
687 jobj.get_string_array( "compatibility" );
688 };
689
690 int num_in_file = 1;
691 if( mod_config_json.test_array() ) {
692 for( const JsonObject &mod_config : mod_config_json.get_array() ) {
693 if( mod_config.get_string( "type" ) == "mod_tileset" ) {
694 if( num_in_file == mts.num_in_file() ) {
695 mark_visited( mod_config );
696 load_internal( mod_config, tileset_root, img_path );
697 break;
698 }
699 num_in_file++;
700 }
701 mod_config.allow_omitted_members();
702 }
703 } else {
704 JsonObject mod_config = mod_config_json.get_object();
705 mark_visited( mod_config );
706 load_internal( mod_config, tileset_root, img_path );
707 }
708 }
709
710 // loop through all tile ids and eliminate empty/invalid things
711 for( auto it = ts.tile_ids.begin(); it != ts.tile_ids.end(); ) {
712 // second is the tile_type describing that id
713 auto &td = it->second;
714 process_variations_after_loading( td.fg );
715 process_variations_after_loading( td.bg );
716 // All tiles need at least foreground or background data, otherwise they are useless.
717 if( td.bg.empty() && td.fg.empty() ) {
718 dbg( DL::Warn ) << "tile " << it->first << " has no (valid) foreground nor background";
719 ts.tile_ids.erase( it++ );
720 } else {
721 ++it;
722 }
723 }
724
725 if( !ts.find_tile_type( "unknown" ) ) {
726 dbg( DL::Warn ) << "The tileset you're using has no 'unknown' tile defined!";
727 }
728 ensure_default_item_highlight();
729
730 ts.tileset_id = tileset_id;
731}
732
733void tileset_loader::load_internal( const JsonObject &config, const std::string &tileset_root,
734 const std::string &img_path )
735{
736 if( config.has_array( "tiles-new" ) ) {
737 // new system, several entries
738 // When loading multiple tileset images this defines where
739 // the tiles from the most recently loaded image start from.
740 for( const JsonObject &tile_part_def : config.get_array( "tiles-new" ) ) {
741 const std::string tileset_image_path = tileset_root + '/' + tile_part_def.get_string( "file" );
742 R = -1;
743 G = -1;
744 B = -1;
745 if( tile_part_def.has_object( "transparency" ) ) {
746 JsonObject tra = tile_part_def.get_object( "transparency" );
747 R = tra.get_int( "R" );
748 G = tra.get_int( "G" );
749 B = tra.get_int( "B" );
750 }
751 sprite_width = tile_part_def.get_int( "sprite_width", ts.tile_width );
752 sprite_height = tile_part_def.get_int( "sprite_height", ts.tile_height );
753 // Now load the tile definitions for the loaded tileset image.
754 sprite_offset.x = tile_part_def.get_int( "sprite_offset_x", 0 );
755 sprite_offset.y = tile_part_def.get_int( "sprite_offset_y", 0 );
756 // First load the tileset image to get the number of available tiles.
757 dbg( DL::Info ) << "Attempting to Load Tileset file " << tileset_image_path;
758 load_tileset( tileset_image_path );
759 load_tilejson_from_file( tile_part_def );
760 if( tile_part_def.has_member( "ascii" ) ) {
761 load_ascii( tile_part_def );
762 }
763 // Make sure the tile definitions of the next tileset image don't
764 // override the current ones.
765 offset += size;
766 }
767 } else {
768 sprite_width = ts.tile_width;
769 sprite_height = ts.tile_height;
770 sprite_offset = point_zero;
771 R = -1;
772 G = -1;
773 B = -1;
774 // old system, no tile file path entry, only one array of tiles
775 dbg( DL::Info ) << "Attempting to Load Tileset file " << img_path;
776 load_tileset( img_path );
777 load_tilejson_from_file( config );
778 offset = size;
779 }
780
781 // allows a tileset to override the order of mutation images being applied to a character
782 if( config.has_array( "overlay_ordering" ) ) {
783 load_overlay_ordering_into_array( config, tileset_mutation_overlay_ordering );
784 }
785
786 // offset should be the total number of sprites loaded from every tileset image
787 // eliminate any sprite references that are too high to exist
788 // also eliminate negative sprite references
789}
790
791void tileset_loader::process_variations_after_loading( weighted_int_list<std::vector<int>> &vs )
792{
793 // loop through all of the variations
794 for( auto &v : vs ) {
795 // in a given variation, erase any invalid sprite ids
796 v.obj.erase(
797 std::remove_if(
798 v.obj.begin(),
799 v.obj.end(),
800 [&]( int id ) {
801 return id >= offset || id < 0;
802 } ),
803 v.obj.end()
804 );
805 }
806 // erase any variations with no valid sprite ids left
807 vs.erase(
808 std::remove_if(
809 vs.begin(),
810 vs.end(),
811 [&]( weighted_object<int, std::vector<int>> o ) {
812 return o.obj.empty();
813 }
814 ),
815 vs.end()
816 );
817 // populate the bookkeeping table used for selecting sprite variations
818 vs.precalc();
819}
820
821void tileset_loader::add_ascii_subtile( tile_type &curr_tile, const std::string &t_id,
822 int sprite_id,
823 const std::string &s_id )
824{
825 const std::string m_id = t_id + "_" + s_id;
826 tile_type curr_subtile;
827 curr_subtile.fg.add( std::vector<int>( {sprite_id} ), 1 );
828 curr_subtile.rotates = true;
829 curr_tile.available_subtiles.push_back( s_id );
830 ts.create_tile_type( m_id, std::move( curr_subtile ) );
831}
832
833void tileset_loader::load_ascii( const JsonObject &config )
834{
835 if( !config.has_member( "ascii" ) ) {
836 config.throw_error( "\"ascii\" section missing" );
837 }
838 for( const JsonObject &entry : config.get_array( "ascii" ) ) {
839 load_ascii_set( entry );
840 }
841}
842
843void tileset_loader::load_ascii_set( const JsonObject &entry )
844{
845 // tile for ASCII char 0 is at `in_image_offset`,
846 // the other ASCII chars follow from there.
847 const int in_image_offset = entry.get_int( "offset" );
848 if( in_image_offset >= size ) {
849 entry.throw_error( "invalid offset (out of range)", "offset" );
850 }
851 // color, of the ASCII char. Can be -1 to indicate all/default colors.
852 int FG = -1;
853 const std::string scolor = entry.get_string( "color", "DEFAULT" );
854 if( scolor == "BLACK" ) {
855 FG = catacurses::black;
856 } else if( scolor == "RED" ) {
857 FG = catacurses::red;
858 } else if( scolor == "GREEN" ) {
859 FG = catacurses::green;
860 } else if( scolor == "YELLOW" ) {
861 FG = catacurses::yellow;
862 } else if( scolor == "BLUE" ) {
863 FG = catacurses::blue;
864 } else if( scolor == "MAGENTA" ) {
865 FG = catacurses::magenta;
866 } else if( scolor == "CYAN" ) {
867 FG = catacurses::cyan;
868 } else if( scolor == "WHITE" ) {
869 FG = catacurses::white;
870 } else if( scolor == "DEFAULT" ) {
871 FG = -1;
872 } else {
873 entry.throw_error( "invalid color for ASCII", "color" );
874 }
875 // Add an offset for bold colors (ncurses has this bold attribute,
876 // this mimics it). bold does not apply to default color.
877 if( FG != -1 && entry.get_bool( "bold", false ) ) {
878 FG += 8;
879 }
880 const int base_offset = offset + in_image_offset;
881 // Finally load all 256 ASCII chars (actually extended ASCII)
882 for( int ascii_char = 0; ascii_char < 256; ascii_char++ ) {
883 const int index_in_image = ascii_char + in_image_offset;
884 if( index_in_image < 0 || index_in_image >= size ) {
885 // Out of range is ignored for now.
886 continue;
887 }
888 const std::string id = get_ascii_tile_id( ascii_char, FG, -1 );
889 tile_type curr_tile;
890 curr_tile.offset = sprite_offset;
891 auto &sprites = *( curr_tile.fg.add( std::vector<int>( {index_in_image + offset} ), 1 ) );
892 switch( ascii_char ) {
893 // box bottom/top side (horizontal line)
894 case LINE_OXOX_C:
895 sprites[0] = 205 + base_offset;
896 break;
897 // box left/right side (vertical line)
898 case LINE_XOXO_C:
899 sprites[0] = 186 + base_offset;
900 break;
901 // box top left
902 case LINE_OXXO_C:
903 sprites[0] = 201 + base_offset;
904 break;
905 // box top right
906 case LINE_OOXX_C:
907 sprites[0] = 187 + base_offset;
908 break;
909 // box bottom right
910 case LINE_XOOX_C:
911 sprites[0] = 188 + base_offset;
912 break;
913 // box bottom left
914 case LINE_XXOO_C:
915 sprites[0] = 200 + base_offset;
916 break;
917 // box bottom north T (left, right, up)
918 case LINE_XXOX_C:
919 sprites[0] = 202 + base_offset;
920 break;
921 // box bottom east T (up, right, down)
922 case LINE_XXXO_C:
923 sprites[0] = 208 + base_offset;
924 break;
925 // box bottom south T (left, right, down)
926 case LINE_OXXX_C:
927 sprites[0] = 203 + base_offset;
928 break;
929 // box X (left down up right)
930 case LINE_XXXX_C:
931 sprites[0] = 206 + base_offset;
932 break;
933 // box bottom east T (left, down, up)
934 case LINE_XOXX_C:
935 sprites[0] = 184 + base_offset;
936 break;
937 }
938 if( ascii_char == LINE_XOXO_C || ascii_char == LINE_OXOX_C ) {
939 curr_tile.rotates = false;
940 curr_tile.multitile = true;
941 add_ascii_subtile( curr_tile, id, 206 + base_offset, "center" );
942 add_ascii_subtile( curr_tile, id, 201 + base_offset, "corner" );
943 add_ascii_subtile( curr_tile, id, 186 + base_offset, "edge" );
944 add_ascii_subtile( curr_tile, id, 203 + base_offset, "t_connection" );
945 add_ascii_subtile( curr_tile, id, 210 + base_offset, "end_piece" );
946 add_ascii_subtile( curr_tile, id, 219 + base_offset, "unconnected" );
947 }
948 ts.create_tile_type( id, std::move( curr_tile ) );
949 }
950}
951
952void tileset_loader::load_tilejson_from_file( const JsonObject &config )
953{
954 if( !config.has_member( "tiles" ) ) {
955 config.throw_error( "\"tiles\" section missing" );
956 }
957
958 for( const JsonObject &entry : config.get_array( "tiles" ) ) {
959 std::vector<std::string> ids;
960 if( entry.has_string( "id" ) ) {
961 ids.push_back( entry.get_string( "id" ) );
962 } else if( entry.has_array( "id" ) ) {
963 ids = entry.get_string_array( "id" );
964 }
965 for( const std::string &t_id : ids ) {
966 tile_type &curr_tile = load_tile( entry, t_id );
967 curr_tile.offset = sprite_offset;
968 bool t_multi = entry.get_bool( "multitile", false );
969 bool t_rota = entry.get_bool( "rotates", t_multi );
970 int t_h3d = entry.get_int( "height_3d", 0 );
971 if( t_multi ) {
972 // fetch additional tiles
973 for( const JsonObject &subentry : entry.get_array( "additional_tiles" ) ) {
974 const std::string s_id = subentry.get_string( "id" );
975 const std::string m_id = t_id + "_" + s_id;
976 tile_type &curr_subtile = load_tile( subentry, m_id );
977 curr_subtile.offset = sprite_offset;
978 curr_subtile.rotates = true;
979 curr_subtile.height_3d = t_h3d;
980 curr_subtile.animated = subentry.get_bool( "animated", false );
981 curr_tile.available_subtiles.push_back( s_id );
982 }
983 } else if( entry.has_array( "additional_tiles" ) ) {
984 entry.throw_error( "Additional tiles defined, but 'multitile' is not true." );
985 }
986 // write the information of the base tile to curr_tile
987 curr_tile.multitile = t_multi;
988 curr_tile.rotates = t_rota;
989 curr_tile.height_3d = t_h3d;
990 curr_tile.animated = entry.get_bool( "animated", false );
991 }
992 }
993 dbg( DL::Info ) << "Tile Width: " << ts.tile_width << " Tile Height: " << ts.tile_height <<
994 " Tile Definitions: " << ts.tile_ids.size();
995}
996
997/**
998 * Load a tile definition and add it to the @ref tileset::tile_ids map.
999 * All loaded tiles go into one vector (@ref tileset::tile_values), their index in it is their id.
1000 * The JSON data (loaded here) contains tile ids relative to the associated image.
1001 * They are translated into global ids by adding the @p offset, which is the number of
1002 * previously loaded tiles (excluding the tiles from the associated image).
1003 * @param id The id of the new tile definition (which is the key in @ref tileset::tile_ids). Any existing
1004 * definition of the same id is overridden.
1005 * @return A reference to the loaded tile inside the @ref tileset::tile_ids map.
1006 */
1007tile_type &tileset_loader::load_tile( const JsonObject &entry, const std::string &id )
1008{
1009 tile_type curr_subtile;
1010
1011 load_tile_spritelists( entry, curr_subtile.fg, "fg" );
1012 load_tile_spritelists( entry, curr_subtile.bg, "bg" );
1013
1014 return ts.create_tile_type( id, std::move( curr_subtile ) );
1015}
1016
1017void tileset_loader::load_tile_spritelists( const JsonObject &entry,
1018 weighted_int_list<std::vector<int>> &vs,
1019 const std::string &objname )
1020{
1021 // json array indicates rotations or variations
1022 if( entry.has_array( objname ) ) {
1023 JsonArray g_array = entry.get_array( objname );
1024 // int elements of array indicates rotations
1025 // create one variation, populate sprite_ids with list of ints
1026 if( g_array.test_int() ) {
1027 std::vector<int> v;
1028 for( const int entry : g_array ) {
1029 const int sprite_id = entry + sprite_id_offset;
1030 if( sprite_id >= 0 ) {
1031 v.push_back( sprite_id );
1032 }
1033 }
1034 vs.add( v, 1 );
1035 }
1036 // object elements of array indicates variations
1037 // create one variation per object
1038 else if( g_array.test_object() ) {
1039 for( const JsonObject &vo : g_array ) {
1040 std::vector<int> v;
1041 int weight = vo.get_int( "weight" );
1042 // negative weight is invalid
1043 if( weight < 0 ) {
1044 vo.throw_error( "Invalid weight for sprite variation (<0)", objname );
1045 }
1046 // int sprite means one sprite
1047 if( vo.has_int( "sprite" ) ) {
1048 const int sprite_id = vo.get_int( "sprite" ) + sprite_id_offset;
1049 if( sprite_id >= 0 ) {
1050 v.push_back( sprite_id );
1051 }
1052 }
1053 // array sprite means rotations
1054 else if( vo.has_array( "sprite" ) ) {
1055 for( const int entry : vo.get_array( "sprite" ) ) {
1056 const int sprite_id = entry + sprite_id_offset;
1057 if( sprite_id >= 0 ) {
1058 v.push_back( sprite_id );
1059 }
1060 }
1061 }
1062 if( v.size() != 1 &&
1063 v.size() != 2 &&
1064 v.size() != 4 ) {
1065 vo.throw_error( "Invalid number of sprites (not 1, 2, or 4)", objname );
1066 }
1067 vs.add( v, weight );
1068 }
1069 }
1070 }
1071 // json int indicates a single sprite id
1072 else if( entry.has_int( objname ) && entry.get_int( objname ) >= 0 ) {
1073 vs.add( std::vector<int>( {entry.get_int( objname ) + sprite_id_offset} ), 1 );
1074 }
1075}
1076
1077struct tile_render_info {
1078 const tripoint pos{};
1079 // accumulator for 3d tallness of sprites rendered here so far;
1080 int height_3d = 0;
1081 lit_level ll;
1082 bool invisible[5];
1083 tile_render_info( const tripoint &pos, const int height_3d, const lit_level ll,
1084 const bool( &invisible )[5] )
1085 : pos( pos ), height_3d( height_3d ), ll( ll ) {
1086 std::copy( invisible, invisible + 5, this->invisible );
1087 }
1088};
1089
1090static int divide_round_down( int a, int b )
1091{
1092 if( b < 0 ) {
1093 a = -a;
1094 b = -b;
1095 }
1096 if( a >= 0 ) {
1097 return a / b;
1098 } else {
1099 return -( ( -a + b - 1 ) / b );
1100 }
1101}
1102
1103void cata_tiles::draw( const point &dest, const tripoint &center, int width, int height,
1104 std::multimap<point, formatted_text> &overlay_strings,
1105 color_block_overlay_container &color_blocks )
1106{
1107 if( !g ) {
1108 return;
1109 }
1110
1111#if defined(__ANDROID__)
1112 // Attempted bugfix for Google Play crash - prevent divide-by-zero if no tile width/height specified
1113 if( tile_width == 0 || tile_height == 0 ) {
1114 return;
1115 }
1116#endif
1117
1118 {
1119 //set clipping to prevent drawing over stuff we shouldn't
1120 SDL_Rect clipRect = {dest.x, dest.y, width, height};
1121 printErrorIf( SDL_RenderSetClipRect( renderer.get(), &clipRect ) != 0,
1122 "SDL_RenderSetClipRect failed" );
1123
1124 //fill render area with black to prevent artifacts where no new pixels are drawn
1125 geometry->rect( renderer, clipRect, SDL_Color() );
1126 }
1127
1128 point s;
1129 get_window_tile_counts( width, height, s.x, s.y );
1130
1131 init_light();
1132 map &here = get_map();
1133 const visibility_variables &cache = here.get_visibility_variables_cache();
1134
1135 const bool iso_mode = tile_iso;
1136
1137 o = iso_mode ? center.xy() : center.xy() - point( POSX, POSY );
1138
1139 op = dest;
1140 // Rounding up to include incomplete tiles at the bottom/right edges
1141 screentile_width = divide_round_up( width, tile_width );
1142 screentile_height = divide_round_up( height, tile_height );
1143
1144 const int min_col = 0;
1145 const int max_col = s.x;
1146 const int min_row = 0;
1147 const int max_row = s.y;
1148
1149 //limit the render area to maximum view range (121x121 square centered on player)
1150 const int min_visible_x = g->u.posx() % SEEX;
1151 const int min_visible_y = g->u.posy() % SEEY;
1152 const int max_visible_x = ( g->u.posx() % SEEX ) + ( MAPSIZE - 1 ) * SEEX;
1153 const int max_visible_y = ( g->u.posy() % SEEY ) + ( MAPSIZE - 1 ) * SEEY;
1154
1155 const auto &ch = g->m.access_cache( center.z );
1156
1157 // Map memory should be at least the size of the view range
1158 // so that new tiles can be memorized, and at least the size of the display
1159 // since at farthest zoom displayed area may be bigger than view range.
1160 const point min_mm_reg = point(
1161 std::min( o.x, min_visible_x ),
1162 std::min( o.y, min_visible_y )
1163 );
1164 const point max_mm_reg = point(
1165 std::max( s.x + o.x, max_visible_x ),
1166 std::max( s.y + o.y, max_visible_y )
1167 );
1168 g->u.prepare_map_memory_region(
1169 g->m.getabs( tripoint( min_mm_reg, center.z ) ),
1170 g->m.getabs( tripoint( max_mm_reg, center.z ) )
1171 );
1172
1173 idle_animations.set_enabled( get_option<bool>( "ANIMATIONS" ) );
1174 idle_animations.prepare_for_redraw();
1175
1176 //set up a default tile for the edges outside the render area
1177 visibility_type offscreen_type = VIS_DARK;
1178 if( cache.u_is_boomered ) {
1179 offscreen_type = VIS_BOOMER_DARK;
1180 }
1181
1182 //retrieve night vision goggle status once per draw
1183 auto vision_cache = g->u.get_vision_modes();
1184 nv_goggles_activated = vision_cache[NV_GOGGLES];
1185
1186 // check that the creature for which we'll draw the visibility map is still alive at that point
1187 if( g->display_overlay_state( ACTION_DISPLAY_VISIBILITY ) && g->displaying_visibility_creature ) {
1188 const Creature *creature = g->displaying_visibility_creature;
1189 const auto is_same_creature_predicate = [&creature]( const Creature & c ) {
1190 return creature == &c;
1191 };
1192 if( g->get_creature_if( is_same_creature_predicate ) == nullptr ) {
1193 g->displaying_visibility_creature = nullptr;
1194 }
1195 }
1196 const point half_tile( tile_width / 2, 0 );
1197 const point quarter_tile( tile_width / 4, tile_height / 4 );
1198 if( g->display_overlay_state( ACTION_DISPLAY_VEHICLE_AI ) ) {
1199 for( const wrapped_vehicle &elem : here.get_vehicles() ) {
1200 const vehicle &veh = *elem.v;
1201 const point veh_pos = veh.global_pos3().xy();
1202 for( const auto &overlay_data : veh.get_debug_overlay_data() ) {
1203 const point pt = veh_pos + std::get<0>( overlay_data );
1204 const int color = std::get<1>( overlay_data );
1205 const std::string &text = std::get<2>( overlay_data );
1206 overlay_strings.emplace( player_to_screen( pt ),
1207 formatted_text( text, color,
1208 text_alignment::left ) );
1209 }
1210 }
1211 }
1212 for( int row = min_row; row < max_row; row ++ ) {
1213 std::vector<tile_render_info> draw_points;
1214 draw_points.reserve( max_col );
1215 for( int col = min_col; col < max_col; col ++ ) {
1216 int temp_x;
1217 int temp_y;
1218 if( iso_mode ) {
1219 //in isometric, rows and columns represent a checkerboard screen space, and we place
1220 //the appropriate tile in valid squares by getting position relative to the screen center.
1221 if( modulo( row - s.y / 2, 2 ) != modulo( col - s.x / 2, 2 ) ) {
1222 continue;
1223 }
1224 temp_x = divide_round_down( col - row - s.x / 2 + s.y / 2, 2 ) + o.x;
1225 temp_y = divide_round_down( row + col - s.y / 2 - s.x / 2, 2 ) + o.y;
1226 } else {
1227 temp_x = col + o.x;
1228 temp_y = row + o.y;
1229 }
1230 const tripoint pos( temp_x, temp_y, center.z );
1231 const int &x = pos.x;
1232 const int &y = pos.y;
1233
1234 lit_level ll;
1235 // invisible to normal eyes
1236 bool invisible[5];
1237 invisible[0] = false;
1238
1239 if( y < min_visible_y || y > max_visible_y || x < min_visible_x || x > max_visible_x ) {
1240 if( has_memory_at( pos ) ) {
1241 ll = lit_level::MEMORIZED;
1242 invisible[0] = true;
1243 } else if( has_draw_override( pos ) ) {
1244 ll = lit_level::DARK;
1245 invisible[0] = true;
1246 } else {
1247 apply_vision_effects( pos, offscreen_type );
1248 continue;
1249 }
1250 } else {
1251 ll = ch.visibility_cache[x][y];
1252 }
1253
1254 // Add scent value to the overlay_strings list for every visible tile when displaying scent
1255 if( g->display_overlay_state( ACTION_DISPLAY_SCENT ) && !invisible[0] ) {
1256 const int scent_value = g->scent.get( pos );
1257 if( scent_value > 0 ) {
1258 overlay_strings.emplace( player_to_screen( point( x, y ) ) + point( tile_width / 2, 0 ),
1259 formatted_text( std::to_string( scent_value ), 8 + catacurses::yellow,
1260 direction::NORTH ) );
1261 }
1262 }
1263
1264 // Add scent type to the overlay_strings list for every visible tile when displaying scent
1265 if( g->display_overlay_state( ACTION_DISPLAY_SCENT_TYPE ) && !invisible[0] ) {
1266 const scenttype_id scent_type = g->scent.get_type( pos );
1267 if( !scent_type.is_empty() ) {
1268 overlay_strings.emplace( player_to_screen( point( x, y ) ) + point( tile_width / 2, 0 ),
1269 formatted_text( scent_type.c_str(), 8 + catacurses::yellow,
1270 direction::NORTH ) );
1271 }
1272 }
1273
1274 if( g->display_overlay_state( ACTION_DISPLAY_RADIATION ) ) {
1275 const auto rad_override = radiation_override.find( pos );
1276 const bool rad_overridden = rad_override != radiation_override.end();
1277 if( rad_overridden || !invisible[0] ) {
1278 const int rad_value = rad_overridden ? rad_override->second : g->m.get_radiation( pos );
1279 catacurses::base_color col;
1280 if( rad_value > 0 ) {
1281 col = catacurses::green;
1282 } else {
1283 col = catacurses::cyan;
1284 }
1285 overlay_strings.emplace( player_to_screen( point( x, y ) ) + point( tile_width / 2, 0 ),
1286 formatted_text( std::to_string( rad_value ), 8 + col, direction::NORTH ) );
1287 }
1288 }
1289
1290 // Add temperature value to the overlay_strings list for every visible tile when displaying temperature
1291 if( g->display_overlay_state( ACTION_DISPLAY_TEMPERATURE ) && !invisible[0] ) {
1292 int temp_value = get_weather().get_temperature( pos );
1293 int ctemp = units::fahrenheit_to_celsius( temp_value );
1294 short color;
1295 const short bold = 8;
1296 if( ctemp > 40 ) {
1297 color = catacurses::red;
1298 } else if( ctemp > 25 ) {
1299 color = catacurses::yellow + bold;
1300 } else if( ctemp > 10 ) {
1301 color = catacurses::green + bold;
1302 } else if( ctemp > 0 ) {
1303 color = catacurses::white + bold;
1304 } else if( ctemp > -10 ) {
1305 color = catacurses::cyan + bold;
1306 } else {
1307 color = catacurses::blue + bold;
1308 }
1309 if( get_option<std::string>( "USE_CELSIUS" ) == "celsius" ) {
1310 temp_value = units::fahrenheit_to_celsius( temp_value );
1311 } else if( get_option<std::string>( "USE_CELSIUS" ) == "kelvin" ) {
1312 temp_value = units::fahrenheit_to_kelvin( temp_value );
1313
1314 }
1315 overlay_strings.emplace( player_to_screen( point( x, y ) ) + point( tile_width / 2, 0 ),
1316 formatted_text( std::to_string( temp_value ), color,
1317 direction::NORTH ) );
1318 }
1319
1320 if( g->display_overlay_state( ACTION_DISPLAY_VISIBILITY ) &&
1321 g->displaying_visibility_creature && !invisible[0] ) {
1322 const bool visibility = g->displaying_visibility_creature->sees( pos );
1323
1324 // color overlay.
1325 auto block_color = visibility ? windowsPalette[catacurses::green] : SDL_Color{ 192, 192, 192, 255 };
1326 block_color.a = 100;
1327 color_blocks.first = SDL_BLENDMODE_BLEND;
1328 color_blocks.second.emplace( player_to_screen( point( x, y ) ), block_color );
1329
1330 // overlay string
1331 std::string visibility_str = visibility ? "+" : "-";
1332 overlay_strings.emplace(
1333 player_to_screen( point( x, y ) ) + point( tile_width / 4, tile_height / 4 ),
1334 formatted_text( visibility_str, catacurses::black, direction::NORTH ) );
1335 }
1336
1337 static std::vector<SDL_Color> lighting_colors;
1338 // color hue in the range of [0..10], 0 being white, 10 being blue
1339 auto draw_debug_tile = [&]( const int color_hue, const std::string & text ) {
1340 if( lighting_colors.empty() ) {
1341 SDL_Color white = { 255, 255, 255, 255 };
1342 SDL_Color blue = { 0, 0, 255, 255 };
1343 lighting_colors = color_linear_interpolate( white, blue, 9 );
1344 }
1345 point tile_pos = player_to_screen( point( x, y ) );
1346
1347 // color overlay
1348 SDL_Color color = lighting_colors[std::min( std::max( 0, color_hue ), 10 )];
1349 color.a = 100;
1350 color_blocks.first = SDL_BLENDMODE_BLEND;
1351 color_blocks.second.emplace( tile_pos, color );
1352
1353 // string overlay
1354 overlay_strings.emplace( tile_pos + quarter_tile, formatted_text( text, catacurses::black,
1355 direction::NORTH ) );
1356 };
1357
1358 if( g->display_overlay_state( ACTION_DISPLAY_LIGHTING ) ) {
1359 if( g->displaying_lighting_condition == 0 ) {
1360 const float light = here.ambient_light_at( {x, y, center.z} );
1361 // note: lighting will be constrained in the [1.0, 11.0] range.
1362 int intensity = static_cast<int>( std::max( 1.0, LIGHT_AMBIENT_LIT - light + 1.0 ) ) - 1;
1363 draw_debug_tile( intensity, string_format( "%.1f", light ) );
1364 }
1365 }
1366
1367 if( g->display_overlay_state( ACTION_DISPLAY_TRANSPARENCY ) ) {
1368 const float tr = here.light_transparency( {x, y, center.z} );
1369 int intensity = tr <= LIGHT_TRANSPARENCY_SOLID ? 10 : static_cast<int>
1370 ( ( tr - LIGHT_TRANSPARENCY_OPEN_AIR ) * 8 );
1371 draw_debug_tile( intensity, string_format( "%.2f", tr ) );
1372 }
1373
1374 if( !invisible[0] && apply_vision_effects( pos, here.get_visibility( ll, cache ) ) ) {
1375 const Creature *critter = g->critter_at( pos, true );
1376 if( has_draw_override( pos ) || has_memory_at( pos ) ||
1377 ( critter && ( g->u.sees_with_infrared( *critter ) || g->u.sees_with_specials( *critter ) ) ) ) {
1378
1379 invisible[0] = true;
1380 } else {
1381 continue;
1382 }
1383 }
1384 for( int i = 0; i < 4; i++ ) {
1385 const tripoint np = pos + neighborhood[i];
1386 invisible[1 + i] = np.y < min_visible_y || np.y > max_visible_y ||
1387 np.x < min_visible_x || np.x > max_visible_x ||
1388 would_apply_vision_effects( g->m.get_visibility( ch.visibility_cache[np.x][np.y], cache ) );
1389 }
1390
1391 int height_3d = 0;
1392
1393 // light level is now used for choosing between grayscale filter and normal lit tiles.
1394 draw_terrain( pos, ll, height_3d, invisible );
1395
1396 draw_points.emplace_back( pos, height_3d, ll, invisible );
1397 }
1398 const std::array<decltype( &cata_tiles::draw_furniture ), 11> drawing_layers = {{
1399 &cata_tiles::draw_furniture, &cata_tiles::draw_graffiti, &cata_tiles::draw_trap,
1400 &cata_tiles::draw_field_or_item, &cata_tiles::draw_vpart_below,
1401 &cata_tiles::draw_critter_at_below, &cata_tiles::draw_terrain_below,
1402 &cata_tiles::draw_vpart, &cata_tiles::draw_critter_at,
1403 &cata_tiles::draw_zone_mark, &cata_tiles::draw_zombie_revival_indicators
1404 }
1405 };
1406 // for each of the drawing layers in order, back to front ...
1407 for( auto f : drawing_layers ) {
1408 // ... draw all the points we drew terrain for, in the same order
1409 for( auto &p : draw_points ) {
1410 ( this->*f )( p.pos, p.ll, p.height_3d, p.invisible );
1411 }
1412 }
1413 // display number of monsters to spawn in mapgen preview
1414 for( const auto &p : draw_points ) {
1415 const auto mon_override = monster_override.find( p.pos );
1416 if( mon_override != monster_override.end() ) {
1417 const int count = std::get<1>( mon_override->second );
1418 const bool more = std::get<2>( mon_override->second );
1419 if( count > 1 || more ) {
1420 std::string text = "x" + std::to_string( count );
1421 if( more ) {
1422 text += "+";
1423 }
1424 overlay_strings.emplace( player_to_screen( p.pos.xy() ) + point( tile_width / 2, 0 ),
1425 formatted_text( text, catacurses::red, direction::NORTH ) );
1426 }
1427 }
1428 }
1429 }
1430 // tile overrides are already drawn in the previous code
1431 void_radiation_override();
1432 void_terrain_override();
1433 void_furniture_override();
1434 void_graffiti_override();
1435 void_trap_override();
1436 void_field_override();
1437 void_item_override();
1438 void_vpart_override();
1439 void_draw_below_override();
1440 void_monster_override();
1441
1442 //Memorize everything the character just saw even if it wasn't displayed.
1443 for( int mem_y = min_visible_y; mem_y <= max_visible_y; mem_y++ ) {
1444 for( int mem_x = min_visible_x; mem_x <= max_visible_x; mem_x++ ) {
1445 half_open_rectangle<point> already_drawn(
1446 point( min_col, min_row ), point( max_col, max_row ) );
1447 if( iso_mode ) {
1448 // calculate the screen position according to the drawing code above (division rounded down):
1449
1450 // mem_x = ( col - row - sx / 2 + sy / 2 ) / 2 + o.x;
1451 // mem_y = ( row + col - sy / 2 - sx / 2 ) / 2 + o.y;
1452 // ( col - sx / 2 ) % 2 = ( row - sy / 2 ) % 2
1453 // ||
1454 // \/
1455 const int col = mem_y + mem_x + s.x / 2 - o.y - o.x;
1456 const int row = mem_y - mem_x + s.y / 2 - o.y + o.x;
1457 if( already_drawn.contains( point( col, row ) ) ) {
1458 continue;
1459 }
1460 } else {
1461 // calculate the screen position according to the drawing code above:
1462
1463 // mem_x = col + o.x
1464 // mem_y = row + o.y
1465 // ||
1466 // \/
1467 // col = mem_x - o.x
1468 // row = mem_y - o.y
1469 if( already_drawn.contains( point( mem_x, mem_y ) - o ) ) {
1470 continue;
1471 }
1472 }
1473 const tripoint p( mem_x, mem_y, center.z );
1474 lit_level lighting = ch.visibility_cache[p.x][p.y];
1475 if( apply_vision_effects( p, g->m.get_visibility( lighting, cache ) ) ) {
1476 continue;
1477 }
1478 int height_3d = 0;
1479 bool invisible[5];
1480 invisible[0] = false;
1481 for( int i = 0; i < 4; i++ ) {
1482 const tripoint np = p + neighborhood[i];
1483 invisible[1 + i] = np.y < min_visible_y || np.y > max_visible_y ||
1484 np.x < min_visible_x || np.x > max_visible_x ||
1485 would_apply_vision_effects( g->m.get_visibility( ch.visibility_cache[np.x][np.y], cache ) );
1486 }
1487 //calling draw to memorize everything.
1488 //bypass cache check in case we learn something new about the terrain's connections
1489 draw_terrain( p, lighting, height_3d, invisible );
1490 if( g->m.check_seen_cache( p ) ) {
1491 draw_furniture( p, lighting, height_3d, invisible );
1492 draw_trap( p, lighting, height_3d, invisible );
1493 draw_vpart( p, lighting, height_3d, invisible );
1494 g->m.check_and_set_seen_cache( p );
1495 }
1496 }
1497 }
1498
1499 in_animation = do_draw_explosion || do_draw_custom_explosion ||
1500 do_draw_bullet || do_draw_hit || do_draw_line ||
1501 do_draw_cursor || do_draw_highlight || do_draw_weather ||
1502 do_draw_sct || do_draw_zones || do_draw_cone_aoe;
1503
1504 draw_footsteps_frame( center );
1505 if( in_animation ) {
1506 if( do_draw_explosion ) {
1507 draw_explosion_frame();
1508 }
1509 if( do_draw_custom_explosion ) {
1510 draw_custom_explosion_frame();
1511 }
1512 if( do_draw_bullet ) {
1513 draw_bullet_frame();
1514 }
1515 if( do_draw_hit ) {
1516 draw_hit_frame();
1517 void_hit();
1518 }
1519 if( do_draw_line ) {
1520 draw_line();
1521 void_line();
1522 }
1523 if( do_draw_weather ) {
1524 draw_weather_frame();
1525 void_weather();
1526 }
1527 if( do_draw_sct ) {
1528 draw_sct_frame( overlay_strings );
1529 void_sct();
1530 }
1531 if( do_draw_zones ) {
1532 draw_zones_frame();
1533 void_zones();
1534 }
1535 if( do_draw_cursor ) {
1536 draw_cursor();
1537 void_cursor();
1538 }
1539 if( do_draw_highlight ) {
1540 draw_highlight();
1541 void_highlight();
1542 }
1543 if( do_draw_cone_aoe ) {
1544 draw_cone_aoe_frame();
1545 }
1546 } else if( g->u.view_offset != tripoint_zero && !g->u.in_vehicle ) {
1547 // check to see if player is located at ter
1548 draw_from_id_string( "cursor", C_NONE, empty_string,
1549 tripoint( g->ter_view_p.xy(), center.z ), 0, 0, lit_level::LIT,
1550 false );
1551 }
1552 if( g->u.controlling_vehicle ) {
1553 if( cata::optional<tripoint> indicator_offset = g->get_veh_dir_indicator_location( true ) ) {
1554 draw_from_id_string( "cursor", C_NONE, empty_string, indicator_offset->xy() + tripoint( g->u.posx(),
1555 g->u.posy(), center.z ),
1556 0, 0, lit_level::LIT, false );
1557 }
1558 }
1559
1560 if( g->debug_submap_grid_overlay && !iso_mode ) {
1561 point sm_start = ms_to_sm_copy( g->m.getabs( point( min_col, min_row ) + o ) );
1562 point sm_end = ms_to_sm_copy( g->m.getabs( point( max_col, max_row ) + o ) );
1563
1564 bool zlevs = g->m.has_zlevels();
1565 int mapsize = g->m.getmapsize();
1566 tripoint mappos = g->m.get_abs_sub();
1567 half_open_rectangle<point> maprect( mappos.xy(), mappos.xy() + point( mapsize, mapsize ) );
1568
1569 const auto is_map = [mappos, zlevs, maprect]( const tripoint & p ) {
1570 if( !maprect.contains( p.xy() ) ) {
1571 return false;
1572 }
1573 if( zlevs ) {
1574 return true;
1575 } else {
1576 return p.z == mappos.z;
1577 }
1578 };
1579
1580 const auto is_mapbuffer = []( const tripoint & p ) {
1581 return MAPBUFFER.is_submap_loaded( p );
1582 };
1583
1584 constexpr int THICC = 1; // line thickness
1585 for( int sm_x = sm_start.x; sm_x <= sm_end.x; sm_x++ ) {
1586 for( int sm_y = sm_start.y; sm_y <= sm_end.y; sm_y++ ) {
1587 point sm_p = point( sm_x, sm_y );
1588 tripoint sm_tp = tripoint( sm_x, sm_y, center.z );
1589 point p1 = player_to_screen( g->m.getlocal( sm_to_ms_copy( sm_p ) ) );
1590 point p3 = player_to_screen( g->m.getlocal( sm_to_ms_copy( sm_p + point_south_east ) ) );
1591 p3 -= point( THICC, THICC ); // Don't draw over other lines
1592
1593 // Leave a small gap to indicate omt boundaries
1594 point tmp = omt_to_sm_copy( sm_to_omt_copy( sm_tp ) ).xy();
1595 if( tmp.x == sm_tp.x ) {
1596 p1.x += 2;
1597 }
1598 if( tmp.y == sm_tp.y ) {
1599 p1.y += 2;
1600 }
1601
1602 SDL_Color col;
1603 if( is_map( sm_tp ) ) {
1604 col = {0, 220, 0, 255};
1605 } else if( is_mapbuffer( sm_tp ) ) {
1606 col = {0, 180, 180, 255};
1607 } else {
1608 col = {0, 0, 220, 255};
1609 }
1610
1611 geometry->vertical_line( renderer, p1, p3.y, THICC, col );
1612 geometry->vertical_line( renderer, point( p3.x, p1.y ), p3.y, THICC, col );
1613 geometry->horizontal_line( renderer, p1, p3.x, THICC, col );
1614 geometry->horizontal_line( renderer, point( p1.x, p3.y ), p3.x, THICC, col );
1615 }
1616 }
1617 }
1618
1619 printErrorIf( SDL_RenderSetClipRect( renderer.get(), nullptr ) != 0,
1620 "SDL_RenderSetClipRect failed" );
1621}
1622
1623bool cata_tiles::terrain_requires_animation() const
1624{
1625 return idle_animations.enabled() && idle_animations.present();
1626}

1629{
1630 minimap->draw( SDL_Rect{ dest.x, dest.y, width, height }, center );
1631}

1636}
1637
1638void cata_tiles::get_window_tile_counts( const int width, const int height, int &columns,
1639 int &rows ) const
1640{
1641 if( tile_iso ) {
1642 columns = std::ceil( static_cast<double>( width ) / tile_width ) * 2 + 4;
1643 rows = std::ceil( static_cast<double>( height ) / ( tile_width / 2.0 - 1 ) ) * 2 + 4;
1644 } else {
1645 columns = std::ceil( static_cast<double>( width ) / tile_width );
1646 rows = std::ceil( static_cast<double>( height ) / tile_height );
1647 }
1648}

1655 ll, apply_night_vision_goggles, nullint );
1656}

1659 const std::string &subcategory, const tripoint &pos,

1664 ll, apply_night_vision_goggles, nullint );
1665}

1671 ll, apply_night_vision_goggles, height_3d );
