1673
1674cata::optional<tile_lookup_res>
1675cata_tiles::find_tile_with_season( const std::string &id ) const
1676{
1677 const season_type season = season_of_year( calendar::turn );
1678 return tileset_ptr->find_tile_type_by_season( id, season );
1679}
1680
1681template<typename T>
1682cata::optional<tile_lookup_res>
1683cata_tiles::find_tile_looks_like_by_string_id( const std::string &id, TILE_CATEGORY category,
1684 const int looks_like_jumps_limit ) const
1685{
1686 const string_id<T> s_id( id );
1687 if( !s_id.is_valid() ) {
1688 return cata::nullopt;
1689 }
1690 const T &obj = s_id.obj();
1691 return find_tile_looks_like( obj.looks_like, category, looks_like_jumps_limit - 1 );
1692}
1693
1694cata::optional<tile_lookup_res>
1695cata_tiles::find_tile_looks_like( const std::string &id, TILE_CATEGORY category,
1696 const int looks_like_jumps_limit ) const
1697{
1698 if( id.empty() || looks_like_jumps_limit <= 0 ) {
1699 return cata::nullopt;
1700 }
1701
1702 // Note on memory management:
1703 // This method must returns pointers to the objects (std::string *id and tile_type * tile)
1704 // that are valid when this metod returns. Ideally they should have the lifetime
1705 // that is equal or exceeds lifetime of `this` or `this::tileset_ptr`.
1706 // For example, `id` argument may have shorter lifetime and thus should not be returned!
1707 // The result of `find_tile_with_season` is OK to be returned, because it's guaranteed to
1708 // return pointers to the keys and values that are stored inside the `tileset_ptr`.
1709 const auto tile_with_season = find_tile_with_season( id );
1710 if( tile_with_season ) {
1711 return tile_with_season;
1712 }
1713
1714 switch( category ) {
1715 case C_FURNITURE:
1716 return find_tile_looks_like_by_string_id<furn_t>( id, category, looks_like_jumps_limit );
1717 case C_TERRAIN:
1718 return find_tile_looks_like_by_string_id<ter_t>( id, category, looks_like_jumps_limit );
1719 case C_FIELD:
1720 return find_tile_looks_like_by_string_id<field_type>( id, category, looks_like_jumps_limit );
1721 case C_MONSTER:
1722 return find_tile_looks_like_by_string_id<mtype>( id, category, looks_like_jumps_limit );
1723 case C_OVERMAP_TERRAIN: {
1724 cata::optional<tile_lookup_res> ret;
1725 const oter_type_str_id type_tmp( id );
1726 if( !type_tmp.is_valid() ) {
1727 return ret;
1728 }
1729
1730 int jump_limit = looks_like_jumps_limit;
1731 for( const std::string &looks_like : type_tmp.obj().looks_like ) {
1732
1733 ret = find_tile_looks_like( looks_like, category, jump_limit - 1 );
1734 if( ret.has_value() ) {
1735 return ret;
1736 }
1737
1738 jump_limit--;
1739 if( jump_limit <= 0 ) {
1740 return ret;
1741 }
1742 }
1743
1744 return ret;
1745 }
1746
1747 case C_VEHICLE_PART: {
1748 // vehicle parts start with vp_ for their tiles, but not their IDs
1749 const vpart_id base_vpid( id.substr( 3 ) );
1750 if( !base_vpid.is_valid() ) {
1751 return cata::nullopt;
1752 }
1753 return find_tile_looks_like( "vp_" + base_vpid.obj().looks_like, category,
1754 looks_like_jumps_limit - 1 );
1755 }
1756 case C_ITEM: {
1757 itype_id iid = itype_id( id );
1758 if( !iid.is_valid() ) {
1759 if( string_starts_with( id, "corpse_" ) ) {
1760 return find_tile_looks_like(
1761 itype_corpse.str(), category, looks_like_jumps_limit - 1
1762 );
1763 }
1764 return cata::nullopt;
1765 }
1766 return find_tile_looks_like( iid->looks_like.str(), category, looks_like_jumps_limit - 1 );
1767 }
1768
1769 default:
1770 return cata::nullopt;
1771 }
1772}
1773
1774bool cata_tiles::find_overlay_looks_like( const bool male, const std::string &overlay,
1775 std::string &draw_id )
1776{
1777 bool exists = false;
1778
1779 std::string looks_like;
1780 std::string over_type;
1781
1782 if( string_starts_with( overlay, "worn_" ) ) {
1783 looks_like = overlay.substr( 5 );
1784 over_type = "worn_";
1785 } else if( string_starts_with( overlay, "wielded_" ) ) {
1786 looks_like = overlay.substr( 8 );
1787 over_type = "wielded_";
1788 } else {
1789 looks_like = overlay;
1790 }
1791
1792 for( int cnt = 0; cnt < 10 && !looks_like.empty(); cnt++ ) {
1793 draw_id = ( male ? "overlay_male_" : "overlay_female_" ) + over_type + looks_like;
1794 if( tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( draw_id ) ) {
1795 exists = true;
1796 break;
1797 }
1798 draw_id = "overlay_" + over_type + looks_like;
1799 if( tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( draw_id ) ) {
1800 exists = true;
1801 break;
1802 }
1803 if( string_starts_with( looks_like, "mutation_active_" ) ) {
1804 looks_like = "mutation_" + looks_like.substr( 16 );
1805 continue;
1806 }
1807 itype_id iid = itype_id( looks_like );
1808 if( !iid.is_valid() ) {
1809 break;
1810 }
1811 looks_like = iid->looks_like.str();
1812 }
1813 return exists;
1814}
1815
1816bool cata_tiles::draw_from_id_string( const std::string &id, TILE_CATEGORY category,
1817 const std::string &subcategory, const tripoint &pos,
1818 int subtile, int rota, lit_level ll,
1819 bool apply_night_vision_goggles, int &height_3d )
1820{
1821 // If the ID string does not produce a drawable tile
1822 // it will revert to the "unknown" tile.
1823 // The "unknown" tile is one that is highly visible so you kinda can't miss it :D
1824
1825 // check to make sure that we are drawing within a valid area
1826 // [0->width|height / tile_width|height]
1827
1828 half_open_rectangle<point> screen_bounds( o, o + point( screentile_width, screentile_height ) );
1829 if( !tile_iso &&
1830 !screen_bounds.contains( pos.xy() ) ) {
1831 return false;
1832 }
1833
1834 cata::optional<tile_lookup_res> res = find_tile_looks_like( id, category );
1835 const tile_type *tt = nullptr;
1836 if( res ) {
1837 tt = &( res->tile() );
1838 }
1839 const std::string &found_id = res ? ( res->id() ) : id;
1840
1841 if( !tt ) {
1842 uint32_t sym = UNKNOWN_UNICODE;
1843 nc_color col = c_white;
1844 if( category == C_FURNITURE ) {
1845 const furn_str_id fid( found_id );
1846 if( fid.is_valid() ) {
1847 const furn_t &f = fid.obj();
1848 sym = f.symbol();
1849 col = f.color();
1850 }
1851 } else if( category == C_TERRAIN ) {
1852 const ter_str_id tid( found_id );
1853 if( tid.is_valid() ) {
1854 const ter_t &t = tid.obj();
1855 sym = t.symbol();
1856 col = t.color();
1857 }
1858 } else if( category == C_MONSTER ) {
1859 const mtype_id mid( found_id );
1860 if( mid.is_valid() ) {
1861 const mtype &mt = mid.obj();
1862 sym = UTF8_getch( mt.sym );
1863 col = mt.color;
1864 }
1865 } else if( category == C_VEHICLE_PART ) {
1866 const vpart_id vpid( found_id.substr( 3 ) );
1867 if( vpid.is_valid() ) {
1868 const vpart_info &v = vpid.obj();
1869
1870 if( subtile == open_ ) {
1871 sym = '\'';
1872 } else if( subtile == broken ) {
1873 sym = v.sym_broken;
1874 } else {
1875 sym = v.sym;
1876 }
1877 subtile = -1;
1878
1879 tileray face = tileray( units::from_degrees( rota ) );
1880 sym = special_symbol( face.dir_symbol( sym ) );
1881 rota = 0;
1882
1883 col = v.color;
1884 }
1885 } else if( category == C_FIELD ) {
1886 const field_type_id fid = field_type_id( found_id );
1887 sym = fid.obj().get_codepoint();
1888 // TODO: field intensity?
1889 col = fid.obj().get_color();
1890 } else if( category == C_TRAP ) {
1891 const trap_str_id tmp( found_id );
1892 if( tmp.is_valid() ) {
1893 const trap &t = tmp.obj();
1894 sym = t.sym;
1895 col = t.color;
1896 }
1897 } else if( category == C_ITEM ) {
1898 item tmp;
1899 if( string_starts_with( found_id, "corpse_" ) ) {
1900 tmp = item( itype_corpse, calendar::start_of_cataclysm );
1901 } else {
1902 tmp = item( found_id, calendar::start_of_cataclysm );
1903 }
1904 sym = tmp.symbol().empty() ? ' ' : tmp.symbol().front();
1905 col = tmp.color();
1906 } else if( category == C_OVERMAP_TERRAIN ) {
1907 const oter_type_str_id tmp( id );
1908 if( tmp.is_valid() ) {
1909 sym = tmp->symbol;
1910 col = tmp->color;
1911 }
1912 } else if( category == C_OVERMAP_NOTE ) {
1913 sym = id[5];
1914 col = color_from_string( id.substr( 7, id.length() - 1 ) );
1915 }
1916 // Special cases for walls
1917 switch( sym ) {
1918 case LINE_XOXO:
1919 case LINE_XOXO_UNICODE:
1920 sym = LINE_XOXO_C;
1921 break;
1922 case LINE_OXOX:
1923 case LINE_OXOX_UNICODE:
1924 sym = LINE_OXOX_C;
1925 break;
1926 case LINE_XXOO:
1927 case LINE_XXOO_UNICODE:
1928 sym = LINE_XXOO_C;
1929 break;
1930 case LINE_OXXO:
1931 case LINE_OXXO_UNICODE:
1932 sym = LINE_OXXO_C;
1933 break;
1934 case LINE_OOXX:
1935 case LINE_OOXX_UNICODE:
1936 sym = LINE_OOXX_C;
1937 break;
1938 case LINE_XOOX:
1939 case LINE_XOOX_UNICODE:
1940 sym = LINE_XOOX_C;
1941 break;
1942 case LINE_XXXO:
1943 case LINE_XXXO_UNICODE:
1944 sym = LINE_XXXO_C;
1945 break;
1946 case LINE_XXOX:
1947 case LINE_XXOX_UNICODE:
1948 sym = LINE_XXOX_C;
1949 break;
1950 case LINE_XOXX:
1951 case LINE_XOXX_UNICODE:
1952 sym = LINE_XOXX_C;
1953 break;
1954 case LINE_OXXX:
1955 case LINE_OXXX_UNICODE:
1956 sym = LINE_OXXX_C;
1957 break;
1958 case LINE_XXXX:
1959 case LINE_XXXX_UNICODE:
1960 sym = LINE_XXXX_C;
1961 break;
1962 default:
1963 // sym goes unchanged
1964 break;
1965 }
1966
1967 if( sym != 0 && sym < 256 ) {
1968 // see cursesport.cpp, function wattron
1969 const int pairNumber = col.to_color_pair_index();
1970 const cata_cursesport::pairs &colorpair = cata_cursesport::colorpairs[pairNumber];
1971 // What about isBlink?
1972 const bool isBold = col.is_bold();
1973 const int FG = colorpair.FG + ( isBold ? 8 : 0 );
1974 std::string generic_id = get_ascii_tile_id( sym, FG, -1 );
1975
1976 // do not rotate fallback tiles!
1977 if( sym != LINE_XOXO_C && sym != LINE_OXOX_C ) {
1978 rota = 0;
1979 }
1980 if( tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( generic_id ) ) {
1981 return draw_from_id_string( generic_id, pos, subtile, rota,
1982 ll, apply_night_vision_goggles );
1983 }
1984 // Try again without color this time (using default color).
1985 generic_id = get_ascii_tile_id( sym, -1, -1 );
1986 if( tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( generic_id ) ) {
1987 return draw_from_id_string( generic_id, pos, subtile, rota,
1988 ll, apply_night_vision_goggles );
1989 }
1990 }
1991 }
1992
1993 // if id is not found, try to find a tile for the category+subcategory combination
1994 if( !tt ) {
1995 const std::string &category_id = TILE_CATEGORY_IDS[category];
1996 if( !category_id.empty() && !subcategory.empty() ) {
1997 tt = tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( "unknown_" + category_id + "_" + subcategory );
1998 }
1999 }
2000
2001 // if at this point we have no tile, try just the category
2002 if( !tt ) {
2003 const std::string &category_id = TILE_CATEGORY_IDS[category];
2004 if( !category_id.empty() ) {
2005 tt = tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( "unknown_" + category_id );
2006 }
2007 }
2008
2009 // if we still have no tile, we're out of luck, fall back to unknown
2010 if( !tt ) {
2011 tt = tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( "unknown" );
2012 }
2013
2014 // this really shouldn't happen, but the tileset creator might have forgotten to define an unknown tile
2015 if( !tt ) {
2016 return false;
2017 }
2018
2019 const tile_type &display_tile = *tt;
2020 // check to see if the display_tile is multitile, and if so if it has the key related to subtile
2021 if( subtile != -1 && display_tile.multitile ) {
2022 const auto &display_subtiles = display_tile.available_subtiles;
2023 const auto end = std::end( display_subtiles );
2024 if( std::find( begin( display_subtiles ), end, multitile_keys[subtile] ) != end ) {
2025 // append subtile name to tile and re-find display_tile
2026 return draw_from_id_string( found_id + "_" + multitile_keys[subtile],
2027 category, subcategory, pos, -1, rota, ll, apply_night_vision_goggles,
2028 height_3d );
2029 }
2030 }
2031
2032 // translate from player-relative to screen relative tile position
2033 const point screen_pos = player_to_screen( pos.xy() );
2034
2035 auto simple_point_hash = []( const auto & p ) {
2036 return p.x + p.y * 65536;
2037 };
2038
2039 bool has_variations = display_tile.fg.size() > 1 || display_tile.bg.size() > 1;
2040 bool variations_enabled = !display_tile.animated || idle_animations.enabled();
2041 // with animated tiles, seed is used for stagger
2042 bool seed_for_animation = has_variations && variations_enabled && display_tile.animated;
2043 bool seed_from_map_coords = false;
2044
2045 // seed the PRNG to get a reproducible random int
2046 // TODO: faster solution here
2047 unsigned int seed = 0;
2048 // TODO: determine ways other than category to differentiate more types of sprites
2049 switch( category ) {
2050 case C_TERRAIN:
2051 case C_FIELD:
2052 case C_LIGHTING:
2053 // stationary map tiles, seed based on map coordinates
2054 seed_from_map_coords = true;
2055 break;
2056 case C_VEHICLE_PART:
2057 // vehicle parts, seed based on coordinates within the vehicle
2058 // TODO: also use some vehicle id, for less predictability
2059 {
2060 // new scope for variable declarations
2061 const auto vp_override = vpart_override.find( pos );
2062 const bool vp_overridden = vp_override != vpart_override.end();
2063 if( vp_overridden ) {
2064 const vpart_id &vp_id = std::get<0>( vp_override->second );
2065 if( vp_id ) {
2066 const point &mount = std::get<4>( vp_override->second );
2067 seed = simple_point_hash( mount );
2068 }
2069 } else {
2070 const optional_vpart_position vp = g->m.veh_at( pos );
2071 if( vp ) {
2072 seed = simple_point_hash( vp->mount() );
2073 }
2074 }
2075
2076 // convert vehicle 360-degree direction (0=E,45=SE, etc) to 4-way tile
2077 // rotation (0=N,1=W,etc)
2078 tileray face = tileray( units::from_degrees( rota ) );
2079 rota = 3 - face.dir4();
2080
2081 }
2082 break;
2083 case C_FURNITURE: {
2084 // If the furniture is not movable, we'll allow seeding by the position
2085 // since we won't get the behavior that occurs where the tile constantly
2086 // changes when the player grabs the furniture and drags it, causing the
2087 // seed to change.
2088 const furn_str_id fid( found_id );
2089 if( fid.is_valid() ) {
2090 const furn_t &f = fid.obj();
2091 if( !f.is_movable() ) {
2092 seed = simple_point_hash( g->m.getabs( pos ) );
2093 }
2094 }
2095 }
2096 break;
2097 case C_ITEM:
2098 case C_TRAP:
2099 if( seed_for_animation ) {
2100 seed_from_map_coords = true;
2101 }
2102 // TODO: come up with ways to make random sprites consistent for these types
2103 break;
2104 case C_OVERMAP_TERRAIN:
2105 seed = simple_point_hash( pos );
2106 break;
2107 case C_NONE:
2108 case C_BULLET:
2109 case C_HIT_ENTITY:
2110 case C_WEATHER:
2111 // TODO: come up with ways to make random sprites consistent for these types
2112 break;
2113 case C_MONSTER:
2114 // FIXME: add persistent id to Creature type, instead of using monster pointer address
2115 if( monster_override.find( pos ) == monster_override.end() ) {
2116 seed = reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>( g->critter_at<monster>( pos ) );
2117 }
2118 break;
2119 default:
2120 // player
2121 if( string_starts_with( found_id, "player_" ) ) {
2122 seed = g->u.name[0];
2123 break;
2124 }
2125 // NPC
2126 if( string_starts_with( found_id, "npc_" ) ) {
2127 if( npc *const guy = g->critter_at<npc>( pos ) ) {
2128 seed = guy->getID().get_value();
2129 break;
2130 }
2131 }
2132 }
2133
2134 // make sure we aren't going to rotate the tile if it shouldn't be rotated
2135 if( !display_tile.rotates && !( category == C_NONE ) && !( category == C_MONSTER ) ) {
2136 rota = 0;
2137 }
2138
2139 unsigned int loc_rand = 0;
2140 // only bother mixing up a hash/random value if the tile has some sprites to randomly pick between
2141 // or has an idle animation and idle animations are enabled
2142 if( has_variations && variations_enabled ) {
2143 if( seed_from_map_coords ) {
2144 seed = simple_point_hash( g->m.getabs( pos ) );
2145 }
2146 static const auto rot32 = []( const unsigned int x, const int k ) {
2147 return ( x << k ) | ( x >> ( 32 - k ) );
2148 };
2149 // use a fair mix function to turn the "random" seed into a random int
2150 // taken from public domain code at http://burtleburtle.net/bob/c/lookup3.c 2015/12/11
2151 unsigned int a = seed, b = -seed, c = seed * seed;
2152 c ^= b;
2153 c -= rot32( b, 14 );
2154 a ^= c;
2155 a -= rot32( c, 11 );
2156 b ^= a;
2157 b -= rot32( a, 25 );
2158 c ^= b;
2159 c -= rot32( b, 16 );
2160 a ^= c;
2161 a -= rot32( c, 4 );
2162 b ^= a;
2163 b -= rot32( a, 14 );
2164 c ^= b;
2165 c -= rot32( b, 24 );
2166 loc_rand = c;
2167
2168 // idle tile animations:
2169 if( display_tile.animated ) {
2170 idle_animations.mark_present();
2171 // offset by loc_rand so that everything does not blink at the same time:
2172 int frame = idle_animations.current_frame() + loc_rand;
2173 int frames_in_loop = display_tile.fg.get_weight();
2174 if( frames_in_loop == 1 ) {
2175 frames_in_loop = display_tile.bg.get_weight();
2176 }
2177 // loc_rand is actually the weighed index of the selected tile, and
2178 // for animations the "weight" is the number of frames to show the tile for:
2179 loc_rand = frame % frames_in_loop;
2180 }
2181 }
2182
2183 //draw it!
2184 draw_tile_at( display_tile, screen_pos, loc_rand, rota, ll,
2185 apply_night_vision_goggles, height_3d );
2186
2187 return true;
2188}
2189
2190bool cata_tiles::draw_sprite_at(
2191 const tile_type &tile, const weighted_int_list<std::vector<int>> &svlist,
2192 const point &p, unsigned int loc_rand, bool rota_fg, int rota, lit_level ll,
2193 bool apply_night_vision_goggles )
2194{
2195 int nullint = 0;
2196 return cata_tiles::draw_sprite_at( tile, svlist, p, loc_rand, rota_fg, rota, ll,
2197 apply_night_vision_goggles, nullint );
2198}
2199
2200bool cata_tiles::draw_sprite_at(
2201 const tile_type &tile, const weighted_int_list<std::vector<int>> &svlist,
2202 const point &p, unsigned int loc_rand, bool rota_fg, int rota, lit_level ll,
2203 bool apply_night_vision_goggles, int &height_3d )
2204{
2205 auto picked = svlist.pick( loc_rand );
2206 if( !picked ) {
2207 return true;
2208 }
2209 auto &spritelist = *picked;
2210 if( spritelist.empty() ) {
2211 return true;
2212 }
2213
2214 int ret = 0;
2215 // blit foreground based on rotation
2216 bool rotate_sprite = false;
2217 int sprite_num = 0;
2218 if( !rota_fg && spritelist.size() == 1 ) {
2219 // don't rotate, a background tile without manual rotations
2220 rotate_sprite = false;
2221 sprite_num = 0;
2222 } else if( spritelist.size() == 1 ) {
2223 // just one tile, apply SDL sprite rotation if not in isometric mode
2224 rotate_sprite = true;
2225 sprite_num = 0;
2226 } else {
2227 // multiple rotated tiles defined, don't apply sprite rotation after picking one
2228 rotate_sprite = false;
2229 // two tiles, tile 0 is N/S, tile 1 is E/W
2230 // four tiles, 0=N, 1=E, 2=S, 3=W
2231 // extending this to more than 4 rotated tiles will require changing rota to degrees
2232 sprite_num = rota % spritelist.size();
2233 }
2234
2235 const texture *sprite_tex = tileset_ptr->get_tile( spritelist[sprite_num] );
2236
2237 //use night vision colors when in use
2238 //then use low light tile if available
2239 if( ll == lit_level::MEMORIZED ) {
2240 if( const auto ptr = tileset_ptr->get_memory_tile( spritelist[sprite_num] ) ) {
2241 sprite_tex = ptr;
2242 }
2243 } else if( apply_night_vision_goggles ) {
2244 if( ll != lit_level::LOW ) {
2245 if( const auto ptr = tileset_ptr->get_overexposed_tile( spritelist[sprite_num] ) ) {
2246 sprite_tex = ptr;
2247 }
2248 } else {
2249 if( const auto ptr = tileset_ptr->get_night_tile( spritelist[sprite_num] ) ) {
2250 sprite_tex = ptr;
2251 }
2252 }
2253 } else if( ll == lit_level::LOW ) {
2254 if( const auto ptr = tileset_ptr->get_shadow_tile( spritelist[sprite_num] ) ) {
2255 sprite_tex = ptr;
2256 }
2257 }
2258
2259 int width = 0;
2260 int height = 0;
2261 std::tie( width, height ) = sprite_tex->dimension();
2262
2263 SDL_Rect destination;
2264 destination.x = p.x + tile.offset.x * tile_width / tileset_ptr->get_tile_width();
2265 destination.y = p.y + ( tile.offset.y - height_3d ) * tile_width / tileset_ptr->get_tile_width();
2266 destination.w = width * tile_width / tileset_ptr->get_tile_width();
2267 destination.h = height * tile_height / tileset_ptr->get_tile_height();
2268
2269 if( rotate_sprite ) {
2270 switch( rota ) {
2271 default:
2272 case 0:
2273 // unrotated (and 180, with just two sprites)
2274 ret = sprite_tex->render_copy_ex( renderer, &destination, 0, nullptr, SDL_FLIP_NONE );
2275 break;
2276 case 1:
2277 // 90 degrees (and 270, with just two sprites)
2278#if defined(_WIN32)
2279 destination.y -= 1;
2280#endif
2281 if( !tile_iso ) {
2282 // never rotate isometric tiles
2283 ret = sprite_tex->render_copy_ex( renderer, &destination, -90, nullptr, SDL_FLIP_NONE );
2284 } else {
2285 ret = sprite_tex->render_copy_ex( renderer, &destination, 0, nullptr, SDL_FLIP_NONE );
2286 }
2287 break;
2288 case 2:
2289 // 180 degrees, implemented with flips instead of rotation
2290 if( !tile_iso ) {
2291 // never flip isometric tiles vertically
2292 ret = sprite_tex->render_copy_ex( renderer, &destination, 0, nullptr,
2293 static_cast<SDL_RendererFlip>( SDL_FLIP_HORIZONTAL | SDL_FLIP_VERTICAL ) );
2294 } else {
2295 ret = sprite_tex->render_copy_ex( renderer, &destination, 0, nullptr, SDL_FLIP_NONE );
2296 }
2297 break;
2298 case 3:
2299 // 270 degrees
2300#if defined(_WIN32)
2301 destination.x -= 1;
2302#endif
2303 if( !tile_iso ) {
2304 // never rotate isometric tiles
2305 ret = sprite_tex->render_copy_ex( renderer, &destination, 90, nullptr, SDL_FLIP_NONE );
2306 } else {
2307 ret = sprite_tex->render_copy_ex( renderer, &destination, 0, nullptr, SDL_FLIP_NONE );
2308 }
2309 break;
2310 case 4:
2311 // flip horizontally
2312 ret = sprite_tex->render_copy_ex( renderer, &destination, 0, nullptr,
2313 static_cast<SDL_RendererFlip>( SDL_FLIP_HORIZONTAL ) );
2314 }
2315 } else {
2316 // don't rotate, same as case 0 above
2317 ret = sprite_tex->render_copy_ex( renderer, &destination, 0, nullptr, SDL_FLIP_NONE );
2318 }
2319
2320 printErrorIf( ret != 0, "SDL_RenderCopyEx() failed" );
2321 // this reference passes all the way back up the call chain back to
2322 // cata_tiles::draw() std::vector<tile_render_info> draw_points[].height_3d
2323 // where we are accumulating the height of every sprite stacked up in a tile
2324 height_3d += tile.height_3d;
2325 return true;
2326}
2327
2328bool cata_tiles::draw_tile_at(
2329 const tile_type &tile, const point &p, unsigned int loc_rand, int rota,
2330 lit_level ll, bool apply_night_vision_goggles, int &height_3d )
2331{
2332 draw_sprite_at( tile, tile.bg, p, loc_rand, /*fg:*/ false, rota, ll,
2333 apply_night_vision_goggles );
2334 draw_sprite_at( tile, tile.fg, p, loc_rand, /*fg:*/ true, rota, ll,
2335 apply_night_vision_goggles, height_3d );
2336 return true;
2337}
2338
2339bool cata_tiles::would_apply_vision_effects( const visibility_type visibility ) const
2340{
2341 return visibility != VIS_CLEAR;
2342}
2343
2344bool cata_tiles::apply_vision_effects( const tripoint &pos,
2345 const visibility_type visibility )
2346{
2347 if( !would_apply_vision_effects( visibility ) ) {
2348 return false;
2349 }
2350 std::string light_name;
2351 switch( visibility ) {
2352 case VIS_HIDDEN:
2353 light_name = "lighting_hidden";
2354 break;
2355 case VIS_LIT:
2356 light_name = "lighting_lowlight_light";
2357 break;
2358 case VIS_BOOMER:
2359 light_name = "lighting_boomered_light";
2360 break;
2361 case VIS_BOOMER_DARK:
2362 light_name = "lighting_boomered_dark";
2363 break;
2364 case VIS_DARK:
2365 light_name = "lighting_lowlight_dark";
2366 break;
2367 case VIS_CLEAR:
2368 // should never happen
2369 break;
2370 }
2371
2372 // lighting is never rotated, though, could possibly add in random rotation?
2373 draw_from_id_string( light_name, C_LIGHTING, empty_string, pos, 0, 0, lit_level::LIT, false );
2374
2375 return true;
2376}
2377
2378bool cata_tiles::draw_terrain_below( const tripoint &p, const lit_level, int &,
2379 const bool ( &invisible )[5] )
2380{
2381 map &here = get_map();
2382 const auto low_override = draw_below_override.find( p );
2383 const bool low_overridden = low_override != draw_below_override.end();
2384 if( low_overridden ? !low_override->second : ( invisible[0] ||
2385 here.dont_draw_lower_floor( p ) ) ) {
2386 return false;
2387 }
2388
2389 tripoint pbelow = tripoint( p.xy(), p.z - 1 );
2390 SDL_Color tercol = curses_color_to_SDL( c_dark_gray );
2391
2392 const ter_t &curr_ter = g->m.ter( pbelow ).obj();
2393 const furn_t &curr_furn = g->m.furn( pbelow ).obj();
2394 int part_below;
2395 int sizefactor = 2;
2396 const vehicle *veh;
2397 // const vehicle *veh;
2398 if( curr_furn.has_flag( TFLAG_SEEN_FROM_ABOVE ) ) {
2399 tercol = curses_color_to_SDL( curr_furn.color() );
2400 } else if( curr_furn.movecost < 0 ) {
2401 tercol = curses_color_to_SDL( curr_furn.color() );
2402 } else if( ( veh = g->m.veh_at_internal( pbelow, part_below ) ) != nullptr ) {
2403 const int roof = veh->roof_at_part( part_below );
2404 const auto vpobst = vpart_position( const_cast<vehicle &>( *veh ), part_below ).obstacle_at_part();
2405 tercol = curses_color_to_SDL( ( roof >= 0 ||
2406 vpobst ) ? c_light_gray : c_magenta );
2407 sizefactor = ( roof >= 0 || vpobst ) ? 4 : 2;
2408 } else if( curr_ter.has_flag( TFLAG_SEEN_FROM_ABOVE ) || curr_ter.movecost == 0 ) {
2409 tercol = curses_color_to_SDL( curr_ter.color() );
2410 } else if( !curr_ter.has_flag( TFLAG_NO_FLOOR ) ) {
2411 sizefactor = 4;
2412 tercol = curses_color_to_SDL( curr_ter.color() );
2413 } else {
2414 tercol = curses_color_to_SDL( curr_ter.color() );
2415 }
2416
2417 SDL_Rect belowRect;
2418 belowRect.h = tile_width / sizefactor;
2419 belowRect.w = tile_height / sizefactor;
2420 if( tile_iso ) {
2421 belowRect.h = ( belowRect.h * 2 ) / 3;
2422 belowRect.w = ( belowRect.w * 3 ) / 4;
2423 }
2424 // translate from player-relative to screen relative tile position
2425 point screen;
2426 if( tile_iso ) {
2427 screen.x = ( ( pbelow.x - o.x ) - ( o.y - pbelow.y ) + screentile_width - 2 ) * tile_width / 2 +
2428 op.x;
2429 // y uses tile_width because width is definitive for iso tiles
2430 // tile footprints are half as tall as wide, arbitrarily tall
2431 screen.y = ( ( pbelow.y - o.y ) - ( pbelow.x - o.x ) - 4 ) * tile_width / 4 +
2432 screentile_height * tile_height / 2 + // TODO: more obvious centering math
2433 op.y;
2434 } else {
2435 screen.x = ( pbelow.x - o.x ) * tile_width + op.x;
2436 screen.y = ( pbelow.y - o.y ) * tile_height + op.y;
2437 }
2438 belowRect.x = screen.x + ( tile_width - belowRect.w ) / 2;
2439 belowRect.y = screen.y + ( tile_height - belowRect.h ) / 2;
2440 if( tile_iso ) {
2441 belowRect.y += tile_height / 8;
2442 }
2443 geometry->rect( renderer, belowRect, tercol );
2444
2445 return true;
2446}
2447
2448bool cata_tiles::draw_terrain( const tripoint &p, const lit_level ll, int &height_3d,
2449 const bool ( &invisible )[5] )
2450{
2451 const auto override = terrain_override.find( p );
2452 const bool overridden = override != terrain_override.end();
2453 bool neighborhood_overridden = overridden;
2454 if( !neighborhood_overridden ) {
2455 for( const point &dir : neighborhood ) {
2456 if( terrain_override.find( p + dir ) != terrain_override.end() ) {
2457 neighborhood_overridden = true;
2458 break;
2459 }
2460 }
2461 }
2462 // first memorize the actual terrain
2463 const ter_id &t = g->m.ter( p );
2464 if( t && !invisible[0] ) {
2465 int subtile = 0;
2466 int rotation = 0;
2467 int connect_group = 0;
2468 if( t.obj().connects( connect_group ) ) {
2469 get_connect_values( p, subtile, rotation, connect_group, {} );
2470 // re-memorize previously seen terrain in case new connections have been seen
2471 g->m.set_memory_seen_cache_dirty( p );
2472 } else {
2473 get_terrain_orientation( p, rotation, subtile, {}, invisible );
2474 // do something to get other terrain orientation values
2475 }
2476 const std::string &tname = t.id().str();
2477 if( g->m.check_seen_cache( p ) ) {
2478 g->u.memorize_tile( g->m.getabs( p ), tname, subtile, rotation );
2479 }
2480 // draw the actual terrain if there's no override
2481 if( !neighborhood_overridden ) {
2482 return draw_from_id_string( tname, C_TERRAIN, empty_string, p, subtile, rotation, ll,
2483 nv_goggles_activated, height_3d );
2484 }
2485 }
2486 if( invisible[0] ? overridden : neighborhood_overridden ) {
2487 // and then draw the override terrain
2488 const ter_id &t2 = overridden ? override->second : t;
2489 if( t2 ) {
2490 // both the current and neighboring overrides may change the appearance
2491 // of the tile, so always re-calculate it.
2492 int subtile = 0;
2493 int rotation = 0;
2494 int connect_group = 0;
2495 if( t2.obj().connects( connect_group ) ) {
2496 get_connect_values( p, subtile, rotation, connect_group, terrain_override );
2497 } else {
2498 get_terrain_orientation( p, rotation, subtile, terrain_override, invisible );
2499 }
2500 const std::string &tname = t2.id().str();
2501 // tile overrides are never memorized
2502 // tile overrides are always shown with full visibility
2503 const lit_level lit = overridden ? lit_level::LIT : ll;
2504 const bool nv = overridden ? false : nv_goggles_activated;
2505 return draw_from_id_string( tname, C_TERRAIN, empty_string, p, subtile, rotation, lit, nv,
2506 height_3d );
2507 }
2508 } else if( invisible[0] && has_terrain_memory_at( p ) ) {
2509 // try drawing memory if invisible and not overridden
2510 const auto &t = get_terrain_memory_at( p );
2511 return draw_from_id_string( t.tile, C_TERRAIN, empty_string, p, t.subtile, t.rotation,
2512 lit_level::MEMORIZED, nv_goggles_activated, height_3d );
2513 }
2514 return false;
2515}

2521 return !t.tile.empty();
2522 }
2523 return false;
2524}

2613
2614bool cata_tiles::draw_furniture( const tripoint &p, const lit_level ll, int &height_3d,
2615 const bool ( &invisible )[5] )
2616{
2617 const auto override = furniture_override.find( p );
2618 const bool overridden = override != furniture_override.end();
2619 bool neighborhood_overridden = overridden;
2620 if( !neighborhood_overridden ) {
2621 for( const point &dir : neighborhood ) {
2622 if( furniture_override.find( p + dir ) != furniture_override.end() ) {
2623 neighborhood_overridden = true;
2624 break;
2625 }
2626 }
2627 }
2628 // first memorize the actual furniture
2629 const furn_id &f = g->m.furn( p );
2630 if( f && !invisible[0] ) {
2631 const int neighborhood[4] = {
2632 static_cast<int>( g->m.furn( p + point_south ) ),
2633 static_cast<int>( g->m.furn( p + point_east ) ),
2634 static_cast<int>( g->m.furn( p + point_west ) ),
2635 static_cast<int>( g->m.furn( p + point_north ) )
2636 };
2637 int subtile = 0;
2638 int rotation = 0;
2639 get_tile_values( f.to_i(), neighborhood, subtile, rotation );
2640 const std::string &fname = f.id().str();
2641 if( g->m.check_seen_cache( p ) ) {
2642 g->u.memorize_tile( g->m.getabs( p ), fname, subtile, rotation );
2643 }
2644 // draw the actual furniture if there's no override
2645 if( !neighborhood_overridden ) {
2646 return draw_from_id_string( fname, C_FURNITURE, empty_string, p, subtile, rotation, ll,
2647 nv_goggles_activated, height_3d );
2648 }
2649 }
2650 if( invisible[0] ? overridden : neighborhood_overridden ) {
2651 // and then draw the override furniture
2652 const furn_id &f2 = overridden ? override->second : f;
2653 if( f2 ) {
2654 // both the current and neighboring overrides may change the appearance
2655 // of the tile, so always re-calculate it.
2656 const auto furn = [&]( const tripoint & q, const bool invis ) -> furn_id {
2657 const auto it = furniture_override.find( q );
2658 return it != furniture_override.end() ? it->second :
2659 ( !overridden || !invis ) ? g->m.furn( q ) : f_null;
2660 };
2661 const int neighborhood[4] = {
2662 static_cast<int>( furn( p + point_south, invisible[1] ) ),
2663 static_cast<int>( furn( p + point_east, invisible[2] ) ),
2664 static_cast<int>( furn( p + point_west, invisible[3] ) ),
2665 static_cast<int>( furn( p + point_north, invisible[4] ) )
2666 };
2667 int subtile = 0;
2668 int rotation = 0;
2669 get_tile_values( f2.to_i(), neighborhood, subtile, rotation );
2670 const std::string &fname = f2.id().str();
2671 // tile overrides are never memorized
2672 // tile overrides are always shown with full visibility
2673 const lit_level lit = overridden ? lit_level::LIT : ll;
2674 const bool nv = overridden ? false : nv_goggles_activated;
2675 return draw_from_id_string( fname, C_FURNITURE, empty_string, p, subtile, rotation, lit, nv,
2676 height_3d );
2677 }
2678 } else if( invisible[0] && has_furniture_memory_at( p ) ) {
2679 // try drawing memory if invisible and not overridden
2680 const auto &t = get_furniture_memory_at( p );
2681 return draw_from_id_string( t.tile, C_FURNITURE, empty_string, p, t.subtile, t.rotation,
2682 lit_level::MEMORIZED, nv_goggles_activated, height_3d );
2683 }
2684 return false;
2685}
2686
2687bool cata_tiles::draw_trap( const tripoint &p, const lit_level ll, int &height_3d,
2688 const bool ( &invisible )[5] )
2689{
2690 const auto override = trap_override.find( p );
2691 const bool overridden = override != trap_override.end();
2692 bool neighborhood_overridden = overridden;
2693 if( !neighborhood_overridden ) {
2694 for( const point &dir : neighborhood ) {
2695 if( trap_override.find( p + dir ) != trap_override.end() ) {
2696 neighborhood_overridden = true;
2697 break;
2698 }
2699 }
2700 }
2701
2702 // first memorize the actual trap
2703 const trap_id &tr = g->m.tr_at( p ).loadid;
2704 if( tr && !invisible[0] && tr.obj().can_see( p, g->u ) ) {
2705 const int neighborhood[4] = {
2706 static_cast<int>( g->m.tr_at( p + point_south ).loadid ),
2707 static_cast<int>( g->m.tr_at( p + point_east ).loadid ),
2708 static_cast<int>( g->m.tr_at( p + point_west ).loadid ),
2709 static_cast<int>( g->m.tr_at( p + point_north ).loadid )
2710 };
2711 int subtile = 0;
2712 int rotation = 0;
2713 get_tile_values( tr.to_i(), neighborhood, subtile, rotation );
2714 const std::string trname = tr.id().str();
2715 if( g->m.check_seen_cache( p ) ) {
2716 g->u.memorize_tile( g->m.getabs( p ), trname, subtile, rotation );
2717 }
2718 // draw the actual trap if there's no override
2719 if( !neighborhood_overridden ) {
2720 return draw_from_id_string( trname, C_TRAP, empty_string, p, subtile, rotation, ll,
2721 nv_goggles_activated, height_3d );
2722 }
2723 }
2724 if( overridden || ( !invisible[0] && neighborhood_overridden && tr.obj().can_see( p, g->u ) ) ) {
2725 // and then draw the override trap
2726 const trap_id &tr2 = overridden ? override->second : tr;
2727 if( tr2 ) {
2728 // both the current and neighboring overrides may change the appearance
2729 // of the tile, so always re-calculate it.
2730 const auto tr_at = [&]( const tripoint & q, const bool invis ) -> trap_id {
2731 const auto it = trap_override.find( q );
2732 return it != trap_override.end() ? it->second :
2733 ( !overridden || !invis ) ? g->m.tr_at( q ).loadid : tr_null;
2734 };
2735 const int neighborhood[4] = {
2736 static_cast<int>( tr_at( p + point_south, invisible[1] ) ),
2737 static_cast<int>( tr_at( p + point_east, invisible[2] ) ),
2738 static_cast<int>( tr_at( p + point_west, invisible[3] ) ),
2739 static_cast<int>( tr_at( p + point_north, invisible[4] ) )
2740 };
2741 int subtile = 0;
2742 int rotation = 0;
2743 get_tile_values( tr2.to_i(), neighborhood, subtile, rotation );
2744 const std::string &trname = tr2.id().str();
2745 // tile overrides are never memorized
2746 // tile overrides are always shown with full visibility
2747 const lit_level lit = overridden ? lit_level::LIT : ll;
2748 const bool nv = overridden ? false : nv_goggles_activated;
2749 return draw_from_id_string( trname, C_TRAP, empty_string, p, subtile, rotation, lit, nv,
2750 height_3d );
2751 }
2752 } else if( invisible[0] && has_trap_memory_at( p ) ) {
2753 // try drawing memory if invisible and not overridden
2754 const auto &t = get_trap_memory_at( p );
2755 return draw_from_id_string( t.tile, C_TRAP, empty_string, p, t.subtile, t.rotation,
2756 lit_level::MEMORIZED, nv_goggles_activated, height_3d );
2757 }
2758 return false;
2759}
2760
2761bool cata_tiles::draw_graffiti( const tripoint &p, const lit_level ll, int &height_3d,
2762 const bool ( &invisible )[5] )
2763{
2764 const auto override = graffiti_override.find( p );
2765 const bool overridden = override != graffiti_override.end();
2766 if( overridden ? !override->second : ( invisible[0] || !g->m.has_graffiti_at( p ) ) ) {
2767 return false;
2768 }
2769 const lit_level lit = overridden ? lit_level::LIT : ll;
2770 return draw_from_id_string( "graffiti", C_NONE, empty_string, p, 0, 0, lit, false, height_3d );
2771}
2772
2773bool cata_tiles::draw_field_or_item( const tripoint &p, const lit_level ll, int &height_3d,
2774 const bool ( &invisible )[5] )
2775{
2776 const auto fld_override = field_override.find( p );
2777 const bool fld_overridden = fld_override != field_override.end();
2778 const field_type_id &fld = fld_overridden ?
2779 fld_override->second : g->m.field_at( p ).displayed_field_type();
2780 bool ret_draw_field = false;
2781 bool ret_draw_items = false;
2782 if( ( fld_overridden || !invisible[0] ) && fld.obj().display_field ) {
2783 const lit_level lit = fld_overridden ? lit_level::LIT : ll;
2784 const bool nv = fld_overridden ? false : nv_goggles_activated;
2785
2786 auto field_at = [&]( const tripoint & q, const bool invis ) -> field_type_id {
2787 const auto it = field_override.find( q );
2788 return it != field_override.end() ? it->second :
2789 ( !fld_overridden || !invis ) ? g->m.field_at( q ).displayed_field_type() : fd_null;
2790 };
2791 // for rotation information
2792 const int neighborhood[4] = {
2793 static_cast<int>( field_at( p + point_south, invisible[1] ) ),
2794 static_cast<int>( field_at( p + point_east, invisible[2] ) ),
2795 static_cast<int>( field_at( p + point_west, invisible[3] ) ),
2796 static_cast<int>( field_at( p + point_north, invisible[4] ) )
2797 };
2798
2799 int subtile = 0;
2800 int rotation = 0;
2801 get_tile_values( fld.to_i(), neighborhood, subtile, rotation );
2802
2803 ret_draw_field = draw_from_id_string( fld.id().str(), C_FIELD, empty_string, p, subtile,
2804 rotation, lit, nv );
2805 }
2806 if( fld.obj().display_items ) {
2807 const auto it_override = item_override.find( p );
2808 const bool it_overridden = it_override != item_override.end();
2809
2810 itype_id it_id;
2811 mtype_id mon_id;
2812 bool hilite;
2813 const itype *it_type;
2814 if( it_overridden ) {
2815 it_id = std::get<0>( it_override->second );
2816 mon_id = std::get<1>( it_override->second );
2817 hilite = std::get<2>( it_override->second );
2818 it_type = &*it_id;
2819 } else if( !invisible[0] && g->m.sees_some_items( p, g->u ) ) {
2820 const maptile &tile = g->m.maptile_at( p );
2821 const item &itm = tile.get_uppermost_item();
2822 const mtype *const mon = itm.get_mtype();
2823 it_id = itm.typeId();
2824 mon_id = mon ? mon->id : mtype_id::NULL_ID();
2825 hilite = tile.get_item_count() > 1;
2826 it_type = itm.type;
2827 } else {
2828 it_type = nullptr;
2829 }
2830 if( it_type && !it_id.is_null() ) {
2831 const std::string disp_id = it_id == itype_corpse && mon_id ?
2832 "corpse_" + mon_id.str() : it_id.str();
2833 const std::string it_category = it_type->get_item_type_string();
2834 const lit_level lit = it_overridden ? lit_level::LIT : ll;
2835 const bool nv = it_overridden ? false : nv_goggles_activated;
2836
2837 ret_draw_items = draw_from_id_string( disp_id, C_ITEM, it_category, p, 0, 0, lit,
2838 nv, height_3d );
2839 if( ret_draw_items && hilite ) {
2840 draw_item_highlight( p );
2841 }
2842 }
2843 }
2844 return ret_draw_field && ret_draw_items;
2845}
2846
2847bool cata_tiles::draw_vpart_below( const tripoint &p, const lit_level /*ll*/, int &/*height_3d*/,
2848 const bool ( &invisible )[5] )
2849{
2850 const auto low_override = draw_below_override.find( p );
2851 const bool low_overridden = low_override != draw_below_override.end();
2852 if( low_overridden ? !low_override->second : ( invisible[0] ||
2853 get_map().dont_draw_lower_floor( p ) ) ) {
2854 return false;
2855 }
2856 tripoint pbelow( p.xy(), p.z - 1 );
2857 int height_3d_below = 0;
2858 bool below_invisible[5];
2859 std::fill( below_invisible, below_invisible + 5, false );
2860 return draw_vpart( pbelow, lit_level::LOW, height_3d_below, below_invisible );
2861}
2862
2863bool cata_tiles::draw_vpart( const tripoint &p, lit_level ll, int &height_3d,
2864 const bool ( &invisible )[5] )
2865{
2866 const auto override = vpart_override.find( p );
2867 const bool overridden = override != vpart_override.end();
2868 map &here = get_map();
2869 // first memorize the actual vpart
2870 const optional_vpart_position vp = here.veh_at( p );
2871 if( vp && !invisible[0] ) {
2872 const vehicle &veh = vp->vehicle();
2873 const int veh_part = vp->part_index();
2874 // Gets the visible part, should work fine once tileset vp_ids are updated to work with the vehicle part json ids
2875 // get the vpart_id
2876 char part_mod = 0;
2877 const vpart_id &vp_id = veh.part_id_string( veh_part, part_mod );
2878 const int subtile = part_mod == 1 ? open_ : part_mod == 2 ? broken : 0;
2879 const int rotation = std::round( to_degrees( veh.face.dir() ) );
2880 const std::string vpname = "vp_" + vp_id.str();
2881 avatar &you = get_avatar();
2882 if( !veh.forward_velocity() && !veh.player_in_control( you ) &&
2883 here.check_seen_cache( p ) ) {
2884 you.memorize_tile( here.getabs( p ), vpname, subtile, rotation );
2885 }
2886 if( !overridden ) {
2887 const cata::optional<vpart_reference> cargopart = vp.part_with_feature( "CARGO", true );
2888 const bool draw_highlight = cargopart && !veh.get_items( cargopart->part_index() ).empty();
2889 const bool ret = draw_from_id_string( vpname, C_VEHICLE_PART, empty_string, p, subtile, rotation,
2890 ll, nv_goggles_activated, height_3d );
2891 if( ret && draw_highlight ) {
2892 draw_item_highlight( p );
2893 }
2894 return ret;
2895 }
2896 }
2897 if( overridden ) {
2898 // and then draw the override vpart
2899 const vpart_id &vp2 = std::get<0>( override->second );
2900 if( vp2 ) {
2901 const char part_mod = std::get<1>( override->second );
2902 const int subtile = part_mod == 1 ? open_ : part_mod == 2 ? broken : 0;
2903 const units::angle rotation = std::get<2>( override->second );
2904 const int draw_highlight = std::get<3>( override->second );
2905 const std::string vpname = "vp_" + vp2.str();
2906 // tile overrides are never memorized
2907 // tile overrides are always shown with full visibility
2908 const bool ret = draw_from_id_string( vpname, C_VEHICLE_PART, empty_string, p,
2909 subtile, to_degrees( rotation ), lit_level::LIT,
2910 false, height_3d );
2911 if( ret && draw_highlight ) {
2912 draw_item_highlight( p );
2913 }
2914 return ret;
2915 }
2916 } else if( invisible[0] && has_vpart_memory_at( p ) ) {
2917 // try drawing memory if invisible and not overridden
2918 const auto &t = get_vpart_memory_at( p );
2919 return draw_from_id_string( t.tile, C_VEHICLE_PART, empty_string, p, t.subtile, t.rotation,
2920 lit_level::MEMORIZED, nv_goggles_activated, height_3d );
2921 }
2922 return false;
2923}
2924
2925bool cata_tiles::draw_critter_at_below( const tripoint &p, const lit_level, int &,
2926 const bool ( &invisible )[5] )
2927{
2928 // Check if we even need to draw below. If not, bail.
2929 const auto low_override = draw_below_override.find( p );
2930 const bool low_overridden = low_override != draw_below_override.end();
2931 if( low_overridden ? !low_override->second : ( invisible[0] ||
2932 get_map().dont_draw_lower_floor( p ) ) ) {
2933 return false;
2934 }
2935
2936 tripoint pbelow( p.xy(), p.z - 1 );
2937
2938 // Get the critter at the location below. If there isn't one,
2939 // we can bail.
2940 const Creature *critter = g->critter_at( pbelow, true );
2941 if( critter == nullptr ) {
2942 return false;
2943 }
2944
2945 // Check if the player can actually see the critter. We don't care if
2946 // it's via infrared or not, just whether or not they're seen. If not,
2947 // we can bail.
2948 if( !g->u.sees( *critter ) && !( g->u.sees_with_infrared( *critter ) ||
2949 g->u.sees_with_specials( *critter ) ) ) {
2950 return false;
2951 }
2952
2953 const point screen_point = player_to_screen( pbelow.xy() );
2954
2955 SDL_Color tercol = curses_color_to_SDL( c_red );
2956 const int sizefactor = 2;
2957
2958 SDL_Rect belowRect;
2959 belowRect.h = tile_width / sizefactor;
2960 belowRect.w = tile_height / sizefactor;
2961
2962 if( tile_iso ) {
2963 belowRect.h = ( belowRect.h * 2 ) / 3;
2964 belowRect.w = ( belowRect.w * 3 ) / 4;
2965 }
2966
2967 belowRect.x = screen_point.x + ( tile_width - belowRect.w ) / 2;
2968 belowRect.y = screen_point.y + ( tile_height - belowRect.h ) / 2;
2969
2970 if( tile_iso ) {
2971 belowRect.y += tile_height / 8;
2972 }
2973
2974 geometry->rect( renderer, belowRect, tercol );
2975
2976 return true;
2977}
2978
2979bool cata_tiles::draw_critter_at( const tripoint &p, lit_level ll, int &height_3d,
2980 const bool ( &invisible )[5] )
2981{
2982 bool result;
2983 bool is_player;
2984 bool sees_player;
2985 Creature::Attitude attitude;
2986 const auto override = monster_override.find( p );
2987 if( override != monster_override.end() ) {
2988 const mtype_id id = std::get<0>( override->second );
2989 if( !id ) {
2990 return false;
2991 }
2992 is_player = false;
2993 sees_player = false;
2994 attitude = std::get<3>( override->second );
2995 const std::string &chosen_id = id.str();
2996 const std::string &ent_subcategory = id.obj().species.empty() ?
2997 empty_string : id.obj().species.begin()->str();
2998 result = draw_from_id_string( chosen_id, C_MONSTER, ent_subcategory, p, corner, 0,
2999 lit_level::LIT, false, height_3d );
3000 } else if( !invisible[0] ) {
3001 const Creature *pcritter = g->critter_at( p, true );
3002 if( pcritter == nullptr ) {
3003 return false;
3004 }
3005 const Creature &critter = *pcritter;
3006
3007 if( !g->u.sees( critter ) ) {
3008 if( g->u.sees_with_infrared( critter ) || g->u.sees_with_specials( critter ) ) {
3009 return draw_from_id_string( "infrared_creature", C_NONE, empty_string, p, 0, 0,
3010 lit_level::LIT, false, height_3d );
3011 }
3012 return false;
3013 }
3014 result = false;
3015 sees_player = false;
3016 is_player = false;
3017 attitude = Creature::A_ANY;
3018 const monster *m = dynamic_cast<const monster *>( &critter );
3019 if( m != nullptr ) {
3020 const auto ent_category = C_MONSTER;
3021 std::string ent_subcategory = empty_string;
3022 if( !m->type->species.empty() ) {
3023 ent_subcategory = m->type->species.begin()->str();
3024 }
3025 const int subtile = corner;
3026 // depending on the toggle flip sprite left or right
3027 int rot_facing = -1;
3028 if( m->facing == FD_RIGHT ) {
3029 rot_facing = 0;
3030 } else if( m->facing == FD_LEFT ) {
3031 rot_facing = 4;
3032 }
3033 if( rot_facing >= 0 ) {
3034 const auto ent_name = m->type->id;
3035 std::string chosen_id = ent_name.str();
3036 if( m->has_effect( effect_ridden ) ) {
3037 int pl_under_height = 6;
3038 if( m->mounted_player ) {
3039 draw_entity_with_overlays( *m->mounted_player, p, ll, pl_under_height );
3040 }
3041 const std::string prefix = "rid_";
3042 std::string copy_id = chosen_id;
3043 const std::string ridden_id = copy_id.insert( 0, prefix );
3044 const tile_type *tt = tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( ridden_id );
3045 if( tt ) {
3046 chosen_id = ridden_id;
3047 }
3048 }
3049 result = draw_from_id_string( chosen_id, ent_category, ent_subcategory, p, subtile, rot_facing,
3050 ll, false, height_3d );
3051 sees_player = m->sees( g->u );
3052 attitude = m->attitude_to( g-> u );
3053 }
3054 }
3055 const player *pl = dynamic_cast<const player *>( &critter );
3056 if( pl != nullptr ) {
3057 draw_entity_with_overlays( *pl, p, ll, height_3d );
3058 result = true;
3059 if( pl->is_player() ) {
3060 is_player = true;
3061 } else {
3062 sees_player = pl->sees( g-> u );
3063 attitude = pl->attitude_to( g-> u );
3064 }
3065 }
3066 } else {
3067 // invisible
3068 const Creature *critter = g->critter_at( p, true );
3069 if( critter && ( g->u.sees_with_infrared( *critter ) || g->u.sees_with_specials( *critter ) ) ) {
3070 // try drawing infrared creature if invisible and not overridden
3071 // return directly without drawing overlay
3072 return draw_from_id_string( "infrared_creature", C_NONE, empty_string, p, 0, 0,
3073 lit_level::LIT, false, height_3d );
3074 } else {
3075 return false;
3076 }
3077 }
3078
3079 if( result && !is_player ) {
3080 std::string draw_id = "overlay_" + Creature::attitude_raw_string( attitude );
3081 if( sees_player ) {
3082 draw_id += "_sees_player";
3083 }
3084 if( tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( draw_id ) ) {
3085 draw_from_id_string( draw_id, C_NONE, empty_string, p, 0, 0, lit_level::LIT, false, height_3d );
3086 }
3087 }
3088 return result;
3089}

3091bool cata_tiles::draw_zone_mark( const tripoint &p, lit_level ll, int &height_3d,
3092 const bool ( &invisible )[5] )
3093{
3094 if( invisible[0] ) {
3095 return false;
3096 }
3097
3098 if( !g->is_zones_manager_open() ) {
3099 return false;
3100 }
3101
3102 const zone_manager &mgr = zone_manager::get_manager();
3103 const tripoint &abs = g->m.getabs( p );
3104 const auto zone = mgr.get_bottom_zone( abs );
3105
3106 if( zone && zone->has_options() ) {
3107 auto option = dynamic_cast<const mark_option *>( &zone->get_options() );
3108
3109 if( option && !option->get_mark().empty() ) {
3110 return draw_from_id_string( option->get_mark(), C_NONE, empty_string, p, 0, 0, ll,
3111 nv_goggles_activated, height_3d );
3112 }
3113 }
3114
3115 return false;
3116}

3118bool cata_tiles::draw_zombie_revival_indicators( const tripoint &pos, const lit_level /*ll*/,
3119 int &/*height_3d*/, const bool ( &invisible )[5] )
3120{

3132
3133void cata_tiles::draw_entity_with_overlays( const Character &ch, const tripoint &p, lit_level ll,
3134 int &height_3d )
3135{
3136 std::string ent_name;
3137
3138 if( ch.is_npc() ) {
3139 ent_name = ch.male ? "npc_male" : "npc_female";
3140 } else {
3141 ent_name = ch.male ? "player_male" : "player_female";
3142 }
3143 // first draw the character itself(i guess this means a tileset that
3144 // takes this seriously needs a naked sprite)
3145 int prev_height_3d = height_3d;
3146
3147 // depending on the toggle flip sprite left or right
3148 if( ch.facing == FD_RIGHT ) {
3149 draw_from_id_string( ent_name, C_NONE, "", p, corner, 0, ll, false, height_3d );
3150 } else if( ch.facing == FD_LEFT ) {
3151 draw_from_id_string( ent_name, C_NONE, "", p, corner, 4, ll, false, height_3d );
3152 }
3153
3154 // next up, draw all the overlays
3155 std::vector<std::string> overlays = ch.get_overlay_ids();
3156 for( const std::string &overlay : overlays ) {
3157 std::string draw_id = overlay;
3158 if( find_overlay_looks_like( ch.male, overlay, draw_id ) ) {
3159 int overlay_height_3d = prev_height_3d;
3160 if( ch.facing == FD_RIGHT ) {
3161 draw_from_id_string( draw_id, C_NONE, "", p, corner, /*rota:*/ 0, ll, false, overlay_height_3d );
3162 } else if( ch.facing == FD_LEFT ) {
3163 draw_from_id_string( draw_id, C_NONE, "", p, corner, /*rota:*/ 4, ll, false, overlay_height_3d );
3164 }
3165 // the tallest height-having overlay is the one that counts
3166 height_3d = std::max( height_3d, overlay_height_3d );
3167 }
3168 }
3169}

3171bool cata_tiles::draw_item_highlight( const tripoint &pos )

3173 return draw_from_id_string( ITEM_HIGHLIGHT, C_NONE, empty_string, pos, 0, 0,
3174 lit_level::LIT, false );
3175}
3176
3177void tileset_loader::ensure_default_item_highlight()
3178{
3179 if( ts.find_tile_type( ITEM_HIGHLIGHT ) ) {
3180 return;
3181 }
3182 const Uint8 highlight_alpha = 127;
3183
3184 int index = ts.tile_values.size();
3185
3186 const SDL_Surface_Ptr surface = create_surface_32( ts.tile_width, ts.tile_height );
3187 assert( surface );
3188 throwErrorIf( SDL_FillRect( surface.get(), nullptr, SDL_MapRGBA( surface->format, 0, 0, 127,
3189 highlight_alpha ) ) != 0, "SDL_FillRect failed" );
3190 ts.tile_values.emplace_back( CreateTextureFromSurface( renderer, surface ), SDL_Rect{ 0, 0, ts.tile_width, ts.tile_height } );
3191 ts.tile_ids[ITEM_HIGHLIGHT].fg.add( std::vector<int>( {index} ), 1 );
3192}

3417/* -- Animation Renders */
3418void cata_tiles::draw_explosion_frame()
3419{
3420 int subtile = 0;
3421 int rotation = 0;
3422
3423 for( int i = 1; i < exp_rad; ++i ) {
3424 subtile = corner;
3425 rotation = 0;
3426
3427 draw_from_id_string( exp_name, exp_pos + point( -i, -i ),
3428 subtile, rotation++, lit_level::LIT, nv_goggles_activated );
3429 draw_from_id_string( exp_name, exp_pos + point( -i, i ),
3430 subtile, rotation++, lit_level::LIT, nv_goggles_activated );
3431 draw_from_id_string( exp_name, exp_pos + point( i, i ),
3432 subtile, rotation++, lit_level::LIT, nv_goggles_activated );
3433 draw_from_id_string( exp_name, exp_pos + point( i, -i ),
3434 subtile, rotation, lit_level::LIT, nv_goggles_activated );
3435
3436 subtile = edge;
3437 for( int j = 1 - i; j < 0 + i; j++ ) {
3438 rotation = 0;
3439 draw_from_id_string( exp_name, exp_pos + point( j, -i ),
3440 subtile, rotation, lit_level::LIT, nv_goggles_activated );
3441 draw_from_id_string( exp_name, exp_pos + point( j, i ),
3442 subtile, rotation, lit_level::LIT, nv_goggles_activated );
3443
3444 rotation = 1;
3445 draw_from_id_string( exp_name, exp_pos + point( -i, j ),
3446 subtile, rotation, lit_level::LIT, nv_goggles_activated );
3447 draw_from_id_string( exp_name, exp_pos + point( i, j ),
3448 subtile, rotation, lit_level::LIT, nv_goggles_activated );
3449 }
3450 }
3451}
3452
3453void cata_tiles::draw_custom_explosion_frame()
3454{
3455 // TODO: Make the drawing code handle all the missing tiles: <^>v and *
3456 // TODO: Add more explosion tiles, like "strong explosion", so that it displays more info
3457
3458 // explosion_weak/explosion_medium/explosion removed from tiles in favor of allowing custom explosion sprites.
3459
3460 int subtile = 0;
3461 int rotation = 0;
3462
3463 for( const auto &pr : custom_explosion_layer ) {
3464 const explosion_neighbors ngh = pr.second.neighborhood;
3465
3466 switch( ngh ) {
3467 case N_NORTH:
3468 case N_SOUTH:
3469 subtile = edge;
3470 rotation = 1;
3471 break;
3472 case N_WEST:
3473 case N_EAST:
3474 subtile = edge;
3475 rotation = 0;
3476 break;
3477 case N_NORTH | N_SOUTH:
3478 case N_NORTH | N_SOUTH | N_WEST:
3479 case N_NORTH | N_SOUTH | N_EAST:
3480 subtile = edge;
3481 rotation = 1;
3482 break;
3483 case N_WEST | N_EAST:
3484 case N_WEST | N_EAST | N_NORTH:
3485 case N_WEST | N_EAST | N_SOUTH:
3486 subtile = edge;
3487 rotation = 0;
3488 break;
3489 case N_SOUTH | N_EAST:
3490 subtile = corner;
3491 rotation = 0;
3492 break;
3493 case N_NORTH | N_EAST:
3494 subtile = corner;
3495 rotation = 1;
3496 break;
3497 case N_NORTH | N_WEST:
3498 subtile = corner;
3499 rotation = 2;
3500 break;
3501 case N_SOUTH | N_WEST:
3502 subtile = corner;
3503 rotation = 3;
3504 break;
3505 case N_NO_NEIGHBORS:
3506 subtile = edge;
3507 break;
3508 case N_WEST | N_EAST | N_NORTH | N_SOUTH:
3509 // Needs some special tile
3510 subtile = edge;
3511 break;
3512 }
3513
3514 const tripoint &p = pr.first;
3515 draw_from_id_string( exp_name, p, subtile, rotation, lit_level::LIT, nv_goggles_activated );
3516 // Used to be divided into explosion_weak/explosion_medium/explosion.
3517 }
3518}
3519void cata_tiles::draw_cone_aoe_frame()
3520{
3521 for( const point_with_value &pv : cone_aoe_layer ) {
3522 const tripoint diff = pv.pt - cone_aoe_origin;
3523 int rotation = ( sgn( diff.x ) == sgn( diff.y ) ? 1 : 0 );
3524 // Should probably jsonize for flamethrower, dragon breath etc.
3525 static const std::array<std::string, 3> sprite_ids = {{
3526 "shot_cone_weak",
3527 "shot_cone_medium",
3528 "shot_cone_strong"
3529 }
3530 };
3531
3532 size_t intensity = ( pv.val >= 1.0 ) + ( pv.val >= 0.5 );
3533 draw_from_id_string( sprite_ids[intensity], pv.pt, 0, rotation, lit_level::LIT, false );
3534 }
3535}
3536void cata_tiles::void_cone_aoe()
3537{

3539 cone_aoe_origin = {-1, -1, -1};
3540 cone_aoe_layer.clear();

3596void cata_tiles::draw_sct_frame( std::multimap<point, formatted_text> &overlay_strings )
3597{
3598 const bool use_font = get_option<bool>( "ANIMATION_SCT_USE_FONT" );
3599
3600 for( auto iter = SCT.vSCT.begin(); iter != SCT.vSCT.end(); ++iter ) {
3601 const point iD( iter->getPosX(), iter->getPosY() );
3602 const int full_text_length = utf8_width( iter->getText() );
3603
3604 int iOffsetX = 0;
3605 int iOffsetY = 0;
3606
3607 for( int j = 0; j < 2; ++j ) {
3608 std::string sText = iter->getText( ( j == 0 ) ? "first" : "second" );
3609 int FG = msgtype_to_tilecolor( iter->getMsgType( ( j == 0 ) ? "first" : "second" ),
3610 iter->getStep() >= SCT.iMaxSteps / 2 );
3611
3612 if( use_font ) {
3613 const auto direction = iter->getDirecton();
3614 // Compensate for string length offset added at SCT creation
3615 // (it will be readded using font size and proper encoding later).
3616 const int direction_offset = ( -direction_XY( direction ).x + 1 ) * full_text_length / 2;
3617
3618 overlay_strings.emplace(
3619 player_to_screen( iD + point( direction_offset, 0 ) ),
3620 formatted_text( sText, FG, direction ) );
3621 } else {
3622 for( auto &it : sText ) {
3623 const std::string generic_id = get_ascii_tile_id( it, FG, -1 );
3624
3625 if( tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( generic_id ) ) {
3626 draw_from_id_string( generic_id, C_NONE, empty_string,
3627 iD + tripoint( iOffsetX, iOffsetY, g->u.pos().z ), 0, 0, lit_level::LIT, false );
3628 }
3629
3630 if( tile_iso ) {
3631 iOffsetY++;
3632 }
3633 iOffsetX++;
3634 }
3635 }
3636 }
3637 }
3638}

3674
3675void cata_tiles::get_terrain_orientation( const tripoint &p, int &rota, int &subtile,
3676 const std::map<tripoint, ter_id> &ter_override, const bool ( &invisible )[5] )
3677{
3678 const bool overridden = ter_override.find( p ) != ter_override.end();
3679 const auto ter = [&]( const tripoint & q, const bool invis ) -> ter_id {
3680 const auto override = ter_override.find( q );
3681 return override != ter_override.end() ? override->second :
3682 ( !overridden || !invis ) ? g->m.ter( q ) : t_null;
3683 };
3684
3685 // get terrain at x,y
3686 const ter_id tid = ter( p, invisible[0] );
3687 if( tid == t_null ) {
3688 subtile = 0;
3689 rota = 0;
3690 return;
3691 }
3692
3693 // get terrain neighborhood
3694 const ter_id neighborhood[4] = {
3695 ter( p + point_south, invisible[1] ),
3696 ter( p + point_east, invisible[2] ),
3697 ter( p + point_west, invisible[3] ),
3698 ter( p + point_north, invisible[4] )
3699 };
3700
3701 char val = 0;
3702
3703 // populate connection information
3704 for( int i = 0; i < 4; ++i ) {
3705 if( neighborhood[i] == tid ) {
3706 val += 1 << i;
3707 }
3708 }
3709
3710 get_rotation_and_subtile( val, rota, subtile );
3711}
3712
3713void cata_tiles::get_rotation_and_subtile( const char val, int &rotation, int &subtile )
3714{
3715 switch( val ) {
3716 // no connections
3717 case 0:
3718 subtile = unconnected;
3719 rotation = 0;
3720 break;
3721 // all connections
3722 case 15:
3723 subtile = center;
3724 rotation = 0;
3725 break;
3726 // end pieces
3727 case 8:
3728 subtile = end_piece;
3729 rotation = 2;
3730 break;
3731 case 4:
3732 subtile = end_piece;
3733 rotation = 3;
3734 break;
3735 case 2:
3736 subtile = end_piece;
3737 rotation = 1;
3738 break;
3739 case 1:
3740 subtile = end_piece;
3741 rotation = 0;
3742 break;
3743 // edges
3744 case 9:
3745 subtile = edge;
3746 rotation = 0;
3747 break;
3748 case 6:
3749 subtile = edge;
3750 rotation = 1;
3751 break;
3752 // corners
3753 case 12:
3754 subtile = corner;
3755 rotation = 2;
3756 break;
3757 case 10:
3758 subtile = corner;
3759 rotation = 1;
3760 break;
3761 case 3:
3762 subtile = corner;
3763 rotation = 0;
3764 break;
3765 case 5:
3766 subtile = corner;
3767 rotation = 3;
3768 break;
3769 // all t_connections
3770 case 14:
3771 subtile = t_connection;
3772 rotation = 2;
3773 break;
3774 case 11:
3775 subtile = t_connection;
3776 rotation = 1;
3777 break;
3778 case 7:
3779 subtile = t_connection;
3780 rotation = 0;
3781 break;
3782 case 13:
3783 subtile = t_connection;
3784 rotation = 3;
3785 break;
3786 }
3787}
3788
3789void cata_tiles::get_connect_values( const tripoint &p, int &subtile, int &rotation,
3790 const int connect_group, const std::map<tripoint, ter_id> &ter_override )
3791{
3792 uint8_t connections = g->m.get_known_connections( p, connect_group, ter_override );
3793 get_rotation_and_subtile( connections, rotation, subtile );
3794}
3795
3796void cata_tiles::get_tile_values( const int t, const int *tn, int &subtile, int &rotation )
3797{
3798 bool connects[4];
3799 char val = 0;
3800 for( int i = 0; i < 4; ++i ) {
3801 connects[i] = ( tn[i] == t );
3802 if( connects[i] ) {
3803 val += 1 << i;
3804 }
3805 }
3806 get_rotation_and_subtile( val, rotation, subtile );
3807}
3808
3809void cata_tiles::do_tile_loading_report()
3810{
3811 DebugLog( DL::Info, DC::Main ) << "Loaded tileset: " << get_option<std::string>( "TILES" );
3812
3813 if( !g->is_core_data_loaded() ) {
3814 // There's nothing to do anymore without the core data.
3815 return;
3816 }
3817
3818 tile_loading_report<ter_t>( ter_t::count(), C_TERRAIN, "" );
3819 tile_loading_report<furn_t>( furn_t::count(), C_FURNITURE, "" );
3820
3821 std::map<itype_id, const itype *> items;
3822 for( const itype *e : item_controller->all() ) {
3823 items.emplace( e->get_id(), e );
3824 }
3825 tile_loading_report( items, C_ITEM, "" );
3826
3827 auto mtypes = MonsterGenerator::generator().get_all_mtypes();
3828 lr_generic( mtypes.begin(), mtypes.end(), []( const std::vector<mtype>::iterator & m ) {
3829 return ( *m ).id.str();
3830 }, C_MONSTER, "" );
3831 tile_loading_report( vpart_info::all(), C_VEHICLE_PART, "vp_" );
3832 tile_loading_report<trap>( trap::count(), C_TRAP, "" );
3833 tile_loading_report<field_type>( field_type::count(), C_FIELD, "" );
3834}
3835
3836point cata_tiles::player_to_screen( const point &p ) const
3837{
3838 point screen;
3839 if( tile_iso ) {
3840 screen.x = ( ( p.x - o.x ) - ( o.y - p.y ) + screentile_width - 2 ) * tile_width / 2 +
3841 op.x;
3842 // y uses tile_width because width is definitive for iso tiles
3843 // tile footprints are half as tall as wide, arbitrarily tall
3844 screen.y = ( ( p.y - o.y ) - ( p.x - o.x ) - 4 ) * tile_width / 4 +
3845 screentile_height * tile_height / 2 + // TODO: more obvious centering math
3846 op.y;
3847 } else {
3848 screen.x = ( p.x - o.x ) * tile_width + op.x;
3849 screen.y = ( p.y - o.y ) * tile_height + op.y;
3850 }
3851 return {screen};
3852}
3853
3854template<typename Iter, typename Func>
3855void cata_tiles::lr_generic( Iter begin, Iter end, Func id_func, TILE_CATEGORY category,
3856 const std::string &prefix )
3857{
3858 std::string missing_list;
3859 std::string missing_with_looks_like_list;
3860 for( ; begin != end; ++begin ) {
3861 const std::string id_string = id_func( begin );
3862
3863 if( !tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( prefix + id_string ) &&
3864 !find_tile_looks_like( id_string, category ) ) {
3865 missing_list.append( id_string + " " );
3866 } else if( !tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( prefix + id_string ) ) {
3867 missing_with_looks_like_list.append( id_string + " " );
3868 }
3869 }
3870 DebugLog( DL::Info, DC::Main ) << "Missing " << TILE_CATEGORY_IDS[category] << ": " << missing_list;
3871 DebugLog( DL::Info, DC::Main ) << "Missing " << TILE_CATEGORY_IDS[category] <<
3872 " (but looks_like tile exists): " << missing_with_looks_like_list;
3873}
3874
3875template <typename maptype>
3876void cata_tiles::tile_loading_report( const maptype &tiletypemap, TILE_CATEGORY category,
3877 const std::string &prefix )
3878{
3879 lr_generic( tiletypemap.begin(), tiletypemap.end(),
3880 []( const decltype( tiletypemap.begin() ) & v ) {
3881 // c_str works for std::string and for string_id!
3882 return v->first.c_str();
3883 }, category, prefix );
3884}
3885
3886template <typename base_type>
3887void cata_tiles::tile_loading_report( const size_t count, TILE_CATEGORY category,
3888 const std::string &prefix )
3889{
3890 lr_generic( static_cast<size_t>( 0 ), count,
3891 []( const size_t i ) {
3892 return int_id<base_type>( i ).id().str();
3893 }, category, prefix );
3894}
3895
3896template <typename arraytype>
3897void cata_tiles::tile_loading_report( const arraytype &array, int array_length,
3898 TILE_CATEGORY category, const std::string &prefix )
3899{
3900 const auto begin = &( array[0] );
3901 lr_generic( begin, begin + array_length,
3902 []( decltype( begin ) const v ) {
3903 return v->id;
3904 }, category, prefix );
3905}
3906
3907std::vector<options_manager::id_and_option> cata_tiles::build_renderer_list()
3908{
3909 std::vector<options_manager::id_and_option> renderer_names;
3910 std::vector<options_manager::id_and_option> default_renderer_names = {
3911# if defined(_WIN32)
3912 { "direct3d", translate_marker( "direct3d" ) },
3913# endif
3914 { "software", translate_marker( "software" ) },
3915 { "opengl", translate_marker( "opengl" ) },
3916 { "opengles2", translate_marker( "opengles2" ) },
3917 };
3918 int numRenderDrivers = SDL_GetNumRenderDrivers();
3919 DebugLog( DL::Info, DC::Main ) << "Number of render drivers on your system: " << numRenderDrivers;
3920 for( int ii = 0; ii < numRenderDrivers; ii++ ) {
3921 SDL_RendererInfo ri;
3922 SDL_GetRenderDriverInfo( ii, &ri );
3923 DebugLog( DL::Info, DC::Main ) << "Render driver: " << ii << "/" << ri.name;
3924 // First default renderer name we will put first on the list. We can use it later as default value.
3925 if( ri.name == default_renderer_names.front().first ) {
3926 renderer_names.emplace( renderer_names.begin(), default_renderer_names.front() );
3927 } else {
3928 renderer_names.emplace_back( ri.name, ri.name );
3929 }
3930
3931 }
3932
3933 return renderer_names.empty() ? default_renderer_names : renderer_names;
3934}
3935
3936std::vector<options_manager::id_and_option> cata_tiles::build_display_list()
3937{
3938 std::vector<options_manager::id_and_option> display_names;
3939 std::vector<options_manager::id_and_option> default_display_names = {
3940 { "0", translate_marker( "Display 0" ) }
3941 };
3942
3943 int numdisplays = SDL_GetNumVideoDisplays();
3944 for( int i = 0 ; i < numdisplays ; i++ ) {
3945 display_names.emplace_back( std::to_string( i ), std::string( SDL_GetDisplayName( i ) ) );
3946 }
3947
3948 return display_names.empty() ? default_display_names : display_names;
3949}
